loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en:
Balykchy is a little town and everything is spread before the eyes. There are not any factories or huge companies. However, the citizens are laborious and ambitious. Burul J., a leader of this group, is a great example to be followed. Burul is delicate woman but has really unimaginable will and strength because she went through a hard trial. Unfortunately, a few years ago her husband died. 

After the death of her husband, life seemed already cracked, and she lost heart, but the future of her daughter really forced her to go ahead. Now, Burul has a daughter who is 16. Her daughter attends a local school in Balykchy. About five years ago, she got a loan of 7,000 Kyrgyzstani som (about $156) and she opened up her business, which is located just inside the house. Since then her life became normal. Now she sells foodstuffs such as macaroni, rice, sugar, salt, oil, fizzy drinks and detergent. 

At present, her net income is about 5,000 KGS (about $110). She wants to get a loan to increase the stock of foodstuffs prior to a holiday season in order to make enough earnings to buy a trade pavilion in the future. Her future plan is to give an education to her daughter, to whom she dedicated her life, and buy and place her own pavilion in her yard.

Nazgul K. is 38. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a driver in the administration of reservoir. She works as a security officer in the administration of reservoir. At present, they are increasing the number of their cattle. Their revenue is 4,000 KGS (about $90). They want to get a loan to buy young plants of apricots and apples to plant in the field. 

Ardakbek K. is 42. He is married and has four children; two of them are sons and two are daughters. His wife is a housewife. He works as a clerk in the city hall. He inherited 20 sheep and, little by little, increased the number of sheep. Now he is just fattening them. He wants to get a loan to buy another sheep and sell them all in the future.

Salima A. is 24. She has two children and a brilliant husband who works as radio operator at the station. Now they are reselling cattle. At first, they bought five of them and after fattening them, they resold them. Their revenue is 4,000 KGS (about $90). They want to get a loan to buy horses.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To increase the stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Balinaki Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Mirabu B. P. is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hard-working and friendly lady, married with seven children aged 20 to 4 years. She takes care of six orphans. 

B. is a business woman who sells textiles (clothes) at various markets. Her biggest challenges are the debtors who often take a long time to pay, and the transportation costs to the markets of Lukolo, Mutai, Kakira, Namulesa, and Budondo where she sells her textiles. 

B. is grateful to her loan facility because it enables her to stock a variety of items and charge fair prices to her customers. B. hopes to someday have a stall where she can sell her clothes instead of moving them to all these markets. She also wants her children to have a university education. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for resale so that she can make more profits and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Suyunkul's Group

texts.en:
On the shore of our beautiful lake, Issyk-Kyl, known as the Pearl of Asia, there is a little village called Bokonbaevo. The people who live here are engaged in agricultural activities because the industry sector has been ruined. However, people are happy and smile. At first sight, it seems that no future is expected, but there is a future. The future which the villagers want to see is full of their dreams and hopes. They do everything possible (and even impossible) to move on. 

Suyunkul T. is one of them. She is a 44-year old married woman. She and her husband have three children. Her daughter, age ten, attends school. Her other two children, a daughter and son, are twins. Her husband works as a taxi driver and earns 10,000 Kyrgyzstani Soms (KGS) a month. (This is about $225.00 U.S. dollars.)

Suyunkul looks after, fattens and resells the family’s cattle. She wants to use her loan to increase the number of livestock. She would like to buy a calf for fattening and reselling later, and she wants to buy domestic appliances with the profit she will gain. 

Guljamal K. is 52 years old. She works as a kindergarten teacher. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a sinker in a gold extracting company. In the future, they plan to buy a car. They would like a loan to buy hay and mixed fodder.

Kulaym Z. is a 50-year old widow. She has a daughter and grandson. Her daughter attends college and her grandson goes to kindergarten. She is a pensioner, but still works as a seamstress in an NGO. She is requesting a loan to buy four sheep, which she would like to breed.

Venera T. is a 50-year old woman who works as a seamstress. She is married and has a daughter who attends a local school. Her husband works in an organization and his salary is 3,000 KGS (about $66.00). He also receives a pension of 2,800 KGS (about $60.00). They want to get a loan to buy three trucks of hay for their cattle. In the near future they want to increase their livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3 Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf for fattening and reselling.

loans.name: Kiira Women's Group, Jinja

texts.en:
N. Shamim is 35 years old and the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a friendly business lady with a kiosk on Kiira road in Jinja, where she sells cold drinks of various kinds, chips, and other confectioneries. She has owned her kiosk for four years and she is grateful that her business started with a loan and it still goes on. 

She is able to make about 120,000 Ugandan shilling (UGX) in profits each week, and she makes sure that she always handles her customers well for better profits. She hopes to expand her kiosk further, buy a plot of land for her two children and her stepchildren, and, together with her husband, pay for their further education. Shamim needs a loan to be able to invest more in her business as well as pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To restock her kiosk with more goods as well as pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel K. N. is a 32-year old married man. He and his wife have one child, who attends school. For the past ten years, Samwel has operated a barber shop. He also earns extra income by charging batteries. 

Samwel is a member of Faulu Kenya and his life has really changed since he started saving his money with the MFI. In addition to saving money, he has also learned how to manage his business by keeping records. Through Faulu Kenya, Samwel has requested a Kiva loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He plans to buy a battery charger and a smoothing machine, and he hopes to open another business in a populated area so that he can attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy a battery charger and a smoothing machine.

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Hamissa M., a married woman with one child, is the owner of a small business. She runs a beautiful salon at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases business goods from the wholesale cosmetics shops at the Kariakoo city shopping center and other shops nearby. 

Hamissa has been in this business for four years and her income enables her to meet her family's daily needs and allows her to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 700,000 Tanzanian shillings (TZS) to boost her business.

loans.use: To boost up her business.

loans.name: Munaku Kawama Bugembe Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Anna N., 36, is the lady in the small photo and she also appears in the big photo. She is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is married with four children, aged 19, 16, 14 and 3 years, and she takes care of her late brother’s children. 

Anna is involved in the tailoring business as well as selling new clothes from the Bugembe trading centre. With the tailoring, she started 21 years ago when she trained in the trade and started sewing, in addition to selling new clothes, to increase her income. She is able to make about 60,000 shillings as profits a week because of her use of the loans and hard work. 

She hopes to expand her businesses further and build a house as she continues to educate her children. Anna has also joined the business of animal husbandry and she hopes her income will increase more once she stabilizes the business. She needs a loan to be able to purchase new stock for her clothes business for an increased capital base.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale

loans.name: Makrina

texts.en: Makrina E. is a small business woman who is married with two school children.  She runs a food shop at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of food products at her shop. She purchases the items directly from wholesale suppliers and shops at the city market shopping center. Business goods sold include; rice, beans, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She has been in this business for four years and she meets the family daily needs through her business income. She is seeking a loan of T.shs 500,000 in order to increase business capital.

loans.use: To increase business capital.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica R. is from Gingoog City. She is 60 years-old and married with eight adult children. Veronica owns and operates a specialized retail store which primarily buys and sells fruit and vegetables in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Veronica joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Veronica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 42 year-old father of three children who attend school.  He was a casual employee before he started selling water.  His wife is a farmer.  He has been running his water business for two years. He is a member of Kiva partner Faulu Kenya and he appreciates that he has learnt how to keep business records.  He has requested a loan of Kes.20,000 to buy a water tank and water pipes.  He hopes to have a financially stable family.  He sees himself operating a well established company in the future.  He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy B. is from the village of Lunao, Gingooog City. She is 33 years-old and unmarried. To make a living, Judy owns and operates a bakeshop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Judy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Judy joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judy is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Elgon Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: J. Sulaiman is in the small photo at the bottom left and also appears in the big photo.  He is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 35 years-old and married with six children aged three to thirteen years.  He has a boda boda (bicycle transport for people) business.  He also is a market vendor and has been selling produce in Namanve for three years.  Although his businesses are affected by seasonal changes, he is able to make 140,000/= profit a week from both and this allows him to take good care of his family and children’s education. Sulaiman needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale and to finish paying the school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy produce for resale and pay children's school fees.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer R. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elmer owns & operates a business providing taxi services to local community members. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Elmer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elmer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jennifer Joyce

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 25 year old single lady who sells used clothing.  She has one employee.  She has been running the business for four years.  She also earns extra income from making handmade carpets.  She has been a member of Faulu Kenya and has learned how to plan and keep business records.

Jennifer has requested a 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of men and women's clothing.  She hopes to have a financially stable family and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy men and women's clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Despina

texts.en:
Despina L. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur, married with one school-aged child. She runs a business keeping poultry, both broilers and layers, at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam.  She constructed three poultry cages: one cage is for broilers and two for layers.  Her business income enabled her to construct two poultry cages and meet her family's daily needs.

She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 Tanzanian Shillings to extend her business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn P. is from the village of San Jose, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Jelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business.
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Faima

texts.en: Faima R. is an entrepreneurial businesswoman in Tanzania. She is married with one child. She runs a clothing shop at Tabata ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her goods from the city market business center at Kariakoo city shopping center from both wholesale and retail shops and resells them to customers at her shop. She has been in the business for three years and the business income helps her pay house rent, business capitalization and meeting the family's daily demands. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 TZS to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 52 years old and married with six children. She lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband.  For almost thirty years, Leonora has been engaged in farming. She is hard-working, determined, and dedicated.

Leonora would like to receive a loan to purchase additional supplies for her farm including fertilizer, pesticides, rice grains, and a tractor.  She enjoys cultivating the land and buying/selling rice in the local markets.

As a very active member since 1995 of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines, Leonora has been a model member, demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. With the help of ASHI, she has already funded the college education of four of her children.  

Leonora’s dreams are for her two youngest children to complete college.  Additionally, she hopes to continue farming as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her farm

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma M. is an entrepreneurial businesswoman. She is married and has two children. She has a business as a food vendor at Mbezi in Dar es Salaam.  She sells different kinds of food, both fried and cooked. She purchases her supplies from the city market and the retail shops around. Income generated is used to capitalize the business and to meet the family's daily needs. She wants a loan of 500,000 TZS to buy more business supplies.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 51 years old, married with one son, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband.  To supply additional income for her family, Mercedita has been buying and selling fish for almost fifteen years. Her husband, Marceliano, is also involved in the fish-selling business and works closely with Mercedita in Rizal.

Mercedita would like to receive a loan to purchase additional supplies for her business, including a fish cage, bamboo, netting, and bait.  Mercedita believes these purchases will increase her fish inventory and drive increased monthly revenue.  A proud member since 1999 of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines, Mercedita has been a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her long term goals are to maintain the profitability of her business, invest in a new home, and support the education of her son.  She hopes that he will have children one day so she can support the college education of her grandchildren.  

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business including a fish cage, bamboo, net, and bait.

loans.name: Joenabith

texts.en:
Joenabith C. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog city. She is 24 years old, single, and has one infant child. To make a living, Joenabith owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Joenabith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Joenabith is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kagala Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Dodovico, shown in the small photo at the top left, also appears in the big photo. He is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is 59 years old and married with sixteen children out of which seven are still in school. He also takes care of one grandson and two granddaughters. 

He is a businessman, and has been involved in selling sugar cane and firewood from Namasiga trading center for twenty-five years. He is able to make a profit of approximately $50 a week and he attributes this to his faithfulness, promptness and the help of the loan. He would like to have access to a sugar cane processor so that he can transform his business to make more profit. 

He also works hard to ensure that he educates all his children so that they get a better life. He needs a loan to be able to purchase more firewood and sugar cane for increased purchases and sales.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and sugar cane for resale.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
At 51 years of age, Arceli T. is a mother focused on her family’s dream. She lives in Coastal Place of Talim Island, Binangonan Rizal, Philippines with her loving husband and two kids. The couple is working hard to give a better education to their children in the future, and they want a better life as well.

They decided to join ASHI, a Kiva field partner, in 2008 to get capital for their business, which is fishing. They have requested a new loan of 15,000 PHP. They will invest this capital in buying a fish cage, more fishnet, rope, bamboo and fingerlings (small fish). 

She hopes to build their own beautiful house, to expand her fishing business and to have a larger space for their fishing equipment. 

The family feels very happy with the loan that improved their lives. Arceli will continue praying and wishing all lenders all the best and good luck, and she hopes they will continue to support poor families like them, who want to improve their standard of living.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy a fish cage, fishnet, rope, bamboo, and fingerlings (small fish).

loans.name: Dorita

texts.en:
Dorita B. is from the village of Barangay 26, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Dorita is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Dorita owns and operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Dorita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $225 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Dorita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dorita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en: Leonides T. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Leonides owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Leonides joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Leonides plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Iganga Road Group, Jinja

texts.en:
K. Justine in the small photo at the top left also appears in the big photo at the bottom left and she is the leader of her lending group in Jinja.

Justine is 50 years old and married with seven children. She also takes care of one dependent.

Justine is a businesswoman involved in the sale of grain that she has supplied to Ugachick poultry farmers for fifteen years now. She is able to make 500,000/= as monthly profits. She supplies grain millings and she would like to supply more and more as much as she can. She would also like to build her own house for comfort.

Justine needs a loan to be able to buy more maize for her supplies.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is married with one 3-year-old daughter. As a busy entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari (general) store for almost five years. Her husband is a motorboat driver in the neighborhood. To build her business, Lilian would like to receive a loan to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store. She is planning to purchase additional products such as rice and gasoline. She believes that offering a wider assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in the community. A dedicated member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines, since 2008, Lillian has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. Lilian’s long terms goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her children. Through hard work and determination, she is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as rice and gasoline

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Virgilio O. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. He is 50 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Virgilio owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Virgilio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Virgilio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred M. is a married man and an entrepreneur. He runs a business buying and selling goats and sheep at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the goats and sheep from the auctions and wholesale suppliers and sells to retail customers for slaughtering as well as to meat suppliers.

Alfred has been in the business for three years and the business income generated helped him to buy a plot of land for house construction and provide business capitalization.

Alfred is requesting a loan of TZS 1,000,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Athuman

texts.en:
Athuman Y. is a married man and a business entrepreneur. He runs a business selling clothes at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases his business goods from the wholesale and retail shops at Kariakoo city market shopping center in Dar es Salaam and sells to retail customers at his shop.

Athuman has been in his business for three years and has managed to expand the business from retail purchases to wholesale purchases using his business income.

Athuman is requesting a loan of TZS 1,000,000 to meet his customers’ demands.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Emaculatha

texts.en:
Emaculatha E. is a married woman and a business entrepreneur. She runs a business selling cooking oil to customers at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam.

Emaculatha purchases her business goods from the wholesale suppliers and sells retail to consumers. She also prepares and sells bites (bread-like rolls).

The business income derived helps Emaculatha to pay the house rent, meet daily family needs, and expand her business. She needs a loan of TZS 600,000 to buy more cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell

Yolanda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. Carlita owns and operates a business selling processed food, selling food products like longganisa (pork sausage flavored with indigenous spices), chorizo (pork sausage) and sometimes, nuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Carlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gilda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosie owns and operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Imani

texts.en:
Imani K. is a small-business married man. He runs a business selling clothes to customers: both secondhand clothes and new clothes for men, women and children.

Imani purchases his business goods from the wholesale shops at Kariakoo and Mnazi Mmoja business city center. His business market is at Zakiemu Mbagala in Dar es Salaam.

Imani has been in the business for four years and the business income pays school fees, house rent and meets his daily family needs. He needs a loan of TZS 1,200,000 to capitalize his business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en: Segundina G. is from the village of Minsapit, Gingoog City. She is 61 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Segundina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Segundina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Segundina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara M. is from Gingoog City. She is 42 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has two adult children. Clara owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Clara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Clara is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mussa

texts.en:
Mussa A. Bilal is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian businessman. He runs a business making and selling furniture at Sabasaba in Dar es Salaam. He purchases his business materials from the wholesale centers at Buguruni and Temeke.

Mussa is a carpenter. He has been in his business for three years and has managed to capitalize his business by buying a power saw power and sanding machines. He also meets his daily family needs from his business income.

Mussa is requesting a loan of TZS 1,200,000 to capitalize his business.

loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou T. est un pêcheur  yoffois de 41 ans. Il  habite plus particulièrement  dans le quartier  de Tonghor  qui est une zone très  proche de la mer et majoritairement habite par des pêcheurs. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis février 2006. Il est marie et père de 6 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 15 ans. Après ses études primaires  il a hérité  cette profession de ses parents et exerce l’activité depuis plus de 30 ans. Pour lui l’aspect le plus intéressant  de son occupation c’est la réalisation de bénéfices  considérables qui lui permettent de subvenir a ses besoins personnels et familiaux. Monsieur T. sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but de réfectionner sa machine et sa pirogue. Ainsi ce crédit pourra lui permettre de mieux rentabiliser son activité  en vue d’une bonne amélioration  de leur cadre de vie social.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou T. is a 41-year-old fisherman from Yoff. More specifically, he lives in the district of Tonghor, which is an area very close to the sea and is inhabited primarily by fishermen. He has been a member of the U-IMCEC Yoff credit union since February 2006. He is married and has 6 children, whose ages very between 2 and 15 years. After his primary education, he took on the job of his parents, and has been involved in this activity for more than 30 years. For him, the most attractive aspect of his occupation is the realization of significant profits that allow him to provide for himself and his family. Mr. T. is seeking a loan of 200,000 FCFA with the goal of repairing his equipment and canoe. Thus, this credit will allow him to make his business more profitable, and thereby improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Méndez de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es madre soltera con dos hijas. 

María empezó vendiendo legumbres y arroz en su casas. Cuando obtuvo el capital suficiente para tener su tienda construyo en la parte delantera de su casa la tienda.

Ahora ella vende bebidas, arroz, enlatados, carnes y ha implementado el servicio de cabinas telefónicas. Trabaja en conjunto con su hija desde muy temprano en la mañana.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber.
texts.en:
María Méndez is 36 years old and lives in the periurban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives electricity as its only basic service. She is a single mother with two daughters.

María began selling vegetables and rice from her home. When she saved up sufficient capital, she opened a store in a space that she built in front of her house. She now sells drinks, rice, canned goods, and meats. Her store is also equipped with phone booths. María and her daughter work together from the very early hours of the morning.

With this loan, María will purchase beverages, rice, and sugar for her business. In the future, she wants to open an Internet café.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Ramón Natividad

texts.es:
El señor Ramón  Natividad Q. M., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempaña como encargado del cementerio, es casado tiene dos hijos, los dos estudian,  uno en la universidad y el otro en secundaria.
El señor Q. lleva ya cuatro créditos con nosotros ha sido excelente cliente y ha sido bien trabajador y siempre dedicado a la preparación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Natividad Q. M. works at the Chinandega mayor's office as the cemetery groundskeeper. He is married with two children, one in college and the other in high school. Mr. Q. has already taken out four loans with us. He has been an excellent client, a hard worker, and is always dedicated to his children's development.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of university tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Jacinta Irene

texts.es:
Jacinta Rodríguez de 56 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 13 años.

Jacinta empezó hace 2 años vendiendo arroz y azúcar en su casa. Cuando obtuvo el capital suficiente para tener su tienda construyo en la parte delantera de su casa la tienda.

Ahora ella vende bebidas, arroz a quintal, enlatados, carnes y también esta implementado el servicio de cabinas telefónicas. Una de las complicaciones que tiene son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, azúcar para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un Minimarket.
texts.en:
Jacinta Rodríguez is 56 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives electricity as its only basic service. She is a single mother with a 13 year old son.

Two years ago, Jacinta began selling rice and sugar out of her house. When she accumulated sufficient capital, she built a store in the front of her house. She now sells drinks, rice, canned goods, and meat. In addition, she installed telephone booths in her store. The heavy rains in the area are among the challenges she faces.

The loan she is requesting will be used to by drinks, rice, and sugar for her business. In the future, she wants to open a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase drinks, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Donald Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Donald Ricardo V. F., trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como Vigilante, tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar.

El señor Donald, es primera vez que solicita crédito con ceprodel, ya que tiene la necesidad de hacer unas reparaciones en su vivienda antes que llegue el invierno, por que su techo se pasa todo cuando llueve.
texts.en:
Donald Ricardo V. F. works for the mayor of Chinandega’s office. He works as a watchman. He has two school-age children. This is the first time that Donald has requested a loan from Ceprodel. He needs to make repairs on his house before winter comes because water comes in through the roof when it rains.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc, cement, and paint

loans.name: Paulino Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Paulino Antonio G. B., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, desempeña el cargo de operario de limpieza, es casado con dos hijos ambos de edad escolar, el señor G. B. lleva ya cinco créditos con nosotros y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, emprendedora y dedicado a sus hijos.
 
El crédito que se le otorgo lo utilizo para terminar de alistar a sus pequeños hijos para ir a clases y  pequeños gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Paulino Antonio G. B. works in the mayor's office in Chinandega El Bisne, Nicaragua. He holds the position of cleaning operator, and he is married with two school-aged children. Mr. G. B. has already taken out five loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL and has demonstrated himself to be responsible, enterprising, and dedicated to his children. The loan he is being granted will be used to prepare his children for school and for small household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For educational expenses

loans.name: Coura

texts.fr: Madame Coura G. est une ancienne sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Ouakam, membre fondateur car elle a été parente bénéficiaire depuis le programme du micro crédit. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 11 prêts antérieurs. Elle habite à Ouakam dans le quartier de Touba à quelques mètres de la caisse. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son mari est un ouvrier polygame. Ses revenus s’avèrent insuffisants pour prendre en charge tous les besoins de la famille. Par conséquent elle a depuis plus de 9 ans évolue dans la petite restauration en vendant le petit déjeuner devant chez elle. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir ses enfants et de prendre en charge une grande partie de ses besoins personnels. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour renforcer son activité car elle envisage d’acheter les produits qui lui permettent de préparer son petit déjeuner et de les stocker. Ces denrées sont le sucre, le petit pois, etc. Les prêts consentis auprès de l’institution lui ont permis de noter un certain avancement dans son activité et d’avoir une certaine stabilité sociale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Coura G. is a long-time member of the bank U-IMCEC Ouakam, a founding member since she was a main beneficiary of the micro-credit program. She has already profited from 11 previous loans. She lives in Ouakam in the neighborhood of Touba, several meters from the bank. She is married and the mother of eight children. Her husband is a manual laborer and polygamous. His income proves insufficient to cover all of the needs of the family. Consequently, for over nine years she has developed a small restaurant, selling breakfast in front of her home. Her profits allow her to support her children and take responsibility for a large part of her own personal needs. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 frs to reinforce her business, as she plans to buy products that allow her to prepare her breakfast and back-stock these goods. These products are sugar, peas, etc. The loans from the institution will allow her to achieve a certain advancement in her business and a certain social stability.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to strengthen working capital

loans.name: Leoncia Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Leoncia Felipa C. G., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza, es soltera con dos hijos, pero solo uno tiene a cargo.

La señora C. G., lleva ya dos créditos con nosotros y le ayuda para sufragar gastos inesperados de su pequeño hijo, ya que su hijo padece de asma  y tiene que tenerlo con medicamento, además como iniciaron las clases también utilizo el crédito para cubrir estos gastos, ha sido una mujer emprendedora.
texts.en:
Leoncia Felipa C. G. works for the mayor of Chinandega’s office. She works as a custodian. She is single, and she has two children. Only one is under her care. C. G. has had two loans with us. They help her defray unexpected costs of her small son. Her son has asthma, and he has to have medication. As classes have started, she will also use the loan to cover those costs. She has been an enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover school expenses

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: El Joven Walter O. tiene tres años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha tenido cinco créditos el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, es soltero vive con sus padres y tres hermanos en la ciudad de Chinandega,  es empleado en la Alcaldía de Chinandega desempeñándose como auditor fiscal  en las diferentes empresas de este departamento, el crédito lo ocupara para cubrir gastos de la familia y para pagar matricula en la universidad ya que estudia Administración.
texts.en:
Walter O. has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. He has taken out five loans, which has shown him to be a responsible person. He is single and lives with his parents and three siblings in Chinandega. Mr. O. works in the Chinandega mayor's office as a fiscal auditor for the different programs within this office. His loan will be used to cover family expenses and university tuition for studying administration.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay university and household expenses

loans.name: Higinio Juvenal

texts.es:
Higinio M. de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Tiene tres hijas. 

Higinio trabajaba en una empresa de cerrajería cuando lo despidieron decidió tener su propio negocio y puso un taller de cerrajería en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Ahora el trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 16h00, en ocasiones tiene que contratar a una persona para que le ayude. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es el dolor de su pierna que fue causada por un disparo.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hierro y soldadura para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener ya empleados fijos en su taller.
texts.en:
Higinio M. is 52 years old and lives in the periurban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and receives electricity and water as its only basic services. He has three daughters.

Higinio previously worked at a locksmith company. When he got laid off, he decided to start his own business and opened a locksmith shop at the front of his house. He now works from 7am until 4pm. Sometimes he will hire an assistant to help with the work. One of the difficulties he faces is the pain in his leg that was caused by a gunshot.

With this loan, he will buy iron and welding equipment for his business. In the future, he hopes to hire full-time employees for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron & welding equipment

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: Clotilde, tiene 22 años, es soltera y ella forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. Clotilde atiende su tienda de abarrotes los domingos en el mercado de Huancarari donde vende comestibles y de lunes a viernes trabaja en el PRONEI(Programa de Nacional de Educación Inicial) como profesora. Clotilde hace un año que abrió una tienda en su domicilio donde vende artesanía. La artesanía lo confecciona su papa y Clotilde se dedica a venderlos entre las cosas que son las chompas y pantalones de lana. Ya son catorce años que su papa se dedica al negocio de artesanía y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Clotilde requiere el préstamo de los 1500 soles, que invertirá en comprar comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas y leche. Clotilde se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 22 and single. She is part of the Once de Mayo-Huancarani Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. Clotilde works in her grocery store in the Huancarari market on Sundays. She sells food. Monday through Friday she works for PRONEI (National Program of Early Education) as a teacher. A year ago Clotilde opened a store in her house where she sells handicrafts. Her father makes the handicrafts, and Clotilde sells them. Some of the things he makes are woolen sweaters and pants. Her father has been in the handicraft business for 14 years. It has gone very well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Clotilde needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy food like rice, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, and milk. Clotilde is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, and milk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña: María Pelicó C. de 45 años de edad, unida de hecho, se dedica actualmente a la agropecuaria, crianza y venta de ganado porcino, esta persona tiene aproximadamente 10 años de dedicarse a la agropecuaria, doña maría ella es la encargada de velar por la familia ya que el esposo de ella falleció  hace 5 años y desde entonces ella ha venido manteniendo a su familia junto a  sus hijos, doña maría se vio en la necesidad de comprar un lote de terreno ya que servirá de mucho para el futuro de sus hijos ya que tendrán un lugar donde poder construir una vivienda, pero como no cuenta con los suficientes recursos económicos por ello fue que doña maría  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR..
texts.en:
Mrs. María Pelicó C. is a 45 year-old widow. She currently works in agriculture and the raising and selling of pigs. She has worked approximately 10 years in agriculture. María is in charge of watching over her family since her husband died five years ago. Since then, she has maintained her family together with her sons. María saw the necessity in buying a lot of land that will serve her children in the future by giving them a place where they can build a house. She does not have the sufficient economic resources to buy the land, which is why María has come to Asociación ASDIR.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying property

loans.name: Las Florecitas Group

texts.es: El grupo las florecitas realizan bondados a mano y como tambien realizan fajas para damas el cual les ayudado a mantenerce y  a sus hijos a que estudien y ellas relatan que lo han realizo mas de 5 años atras y esto los a sacado a vante y acuden a la asociaciòn Asdir para que se le puedan ayudar  para el incremento de su capital para cubrir los diferentes pedidos que tienen y asi poder ganar y sacar a sus hijos y a la familia avante y tener otro nivel de vida y ellas estan seguro con esta ayuda alcanzaran las metas establecido para este año 2010.-
texts.en:
The group "Las Florecitas" (The Little Flowers) do hand embroidery and also make girdles for women. Their work helps them support themselves and their children who are studying in school. They tell us they have been doing this work for more than five years, and it has allowed them to get ahead in life. They came to the Asociaciòn Asdir so they can increase their business capital to cover the different orders they have. This will allow them to move forward with their children and families and have a higher level of life. They are sure that with this help they will achieve their established goals for this year.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Celestino, tiene 28 años y es soltero. El socio Celestino forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene un pequeño restaurante de venta de comida en la plaza mprincipal de la ciudad. El socio Celestino vende cerveza y comida, ya son dos años que abrió su local y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Celestino es un joven trabajador que requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles, que invertirá en comprar más insumos como carne, fideos y arroz y también para comprar más cerveza.
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

(El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Celestino is 28 years old and single. Celestino is part of the Asociación Arariwa's community bank “Once de Mayo - Huancarani." He has a small restaurant where he sells food in the city's principal plaza. Celestino sells food and beer. He opened his business two years ago and has done very well due to the effort he puts into his work. Celestino is a young worker who needs a loan of 500 soles to invest in buying more food supplies like meat, pasta, and rice as well as to buy more beer. Celestino is grateful for the opportunity given to him through Kiva, and he promises to complete his repayment according to the timeline. (The Peruvian district Huancarani is one of the 6 districts in the Paucartambo province, located in the department of Cusco in the Cusco region).

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying meat, pasta, rice, and beer

loans.name: Ana Marcelina's Group

texts.es: Este grupito de Mujeres se han dedicado  unos 8 años atras, a la compra y venta de ropa tipica nuvas y usadas que lo llevan a otros pueblos aledaños para ganar el sustento cotidiano y ellas quieren comprar màs mercaderia y poder dender màs y obtener màs ganancias, quieren salir avante y obtener otro nivel de vida y ellas cuentan que estan luchando para la vida y quieren mandar a sus hijos a estudiar y que ellos no sufre como ellas han sufrido segun lo que relatan y por eso acuden a la ASOCIACION  para que se le pueda ayudar para el incremento de sus capitales.
texts.en:
This small group of women have been dedicated for the last 8 years to buying and selling typical (native) clothing, new and used, which they trade in neighboring villages to earn their daily sustenance. They want to buy more merchandise, in order to sell more and obtain greater earnings. They want to get ahead and obtain a higher level of living. They say that they are struggling for survival and want to send their children to school so that they will not suffer like their mothers have, as they explained. For this reason they are approaching the ASSOCIATION so that it could help them to increase their capital.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE NEW AND USED TYPICAL CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita, tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales uno es independiente y tres depende de ella todavía, ella forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. Benita se dedica a la venta de ropa en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani y también vende comida. Felipa nos cuenta que ya son cinco años se dedica a la venta de comida y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Benita requiere el préstamo de los 2000 soles, que invertirá en comprar más ropa. Benita se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Benita is 40 years old, has a live-in partner, and 4 children, of whom 1 is independent and 3 still depend on her. She belongs to the “Once de Mayo (11th of May) – Huancarani” Communal Bank, which is affiliated with the Arariwa Association. Benita sells cloths in the principal square of the city of Huancarani, and she also sells meals. She tells us that she has sold meals for 5 years and that it has gone well, due to the effort she has put into her work. Benita needs a loan of 2,000 New Sols to invest in buying more clothing to sell. She is very grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and, also, she promises to comply with the corresponding repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Claudio, tiene 45 años y es casado. El socio Claudio forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. El socio Claudio se dedica a la compra de ganado y venta de carne, el nos cuenta que compra ganado en la ciudad de Huancarari a sus vecinos y después lleva carne a la ciudad de Cosñipata (Es uno de los distritos de Paucartambo). Ya son diez años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Claudio  es un padre trabajador que requiere el préstamo de los 1900 soles, que invertirá en comprar más ganado como tres ovejas y también va comprar papa, chuño, habas y trigo.  
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

(El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Claudio is 45-years old and married. He belongs to the "Once de Mayo-Huancarani" community bank, which is a part of Asociacion Arariwa. Claudio buys livestock in the town of Huncarani and then sells the meat in Cosnipata (one of the districts of Paucartambo). This has been his job for 10 years and he has done very well thanks to his strong work ethic. Claudio is a hard-working father who is requesting a loan of 1900 soles which he will use to purchase additional livestock (including three sheep) as well as potatoes, dried potatoes, beans, and wheat. He is extemely thankful for this loan opportunity and he commits himself to pay back the loan on schedule. (The district of Huancarani is one of the 6 districts of the Paucartambo province, located in the department of Cuzco, within the region of Cuzco, Peru).

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock, potatoes, beans, and wheat

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teófila, de 32 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para brindarle a su familia una mejor vida. Vive en la casa de su madre junto a sus 2 hijos; Jason de 9 y Daina de 5, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Apoyada por sus padres, cuando tenía 20 años decidió comprar unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera sembrar y ayudar así en la economía de su familia. Actualmente sigue trabajando en esas tierras, pero ahora le ayudan sus queridos hijos, con lo que obtienen lo necesario para brindarles una buena educación y velar por su salud.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. Para más adelante, espera que los costos de las verduras en el mercado suban, ya que de lo contrario su capital de trabajo se verá afectado.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP,  está muy emocionada por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, pues siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP,  está muy emocionada por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, pues siempre pone orden en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Teófila, age 32, is a woman who has always worked hard to give her family a better life. She lives in her mother’s house with her two children. Jason is 9, and Daina is 5. They are the reason for all of her efforts. When she was 20, with her parents support, she bought some land where she could plant and help the family economically. She currently continues working this land, but now her dear children help her. With the land they get what they need to give the children a good education and to see to their health. What she likes best about her work is the close relationship she has with the earth. Also, she really enjoys seeing her plants grow. She has been doing this for 12 years. The most difficult part is taking care of the fields and protecting them from bad weather. Any oversight could affect the harvest. In the future she hopes that the prices for vegetables in the market rise. If they do not, her work capital will be affected. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very excited to get it because she urgently needs it to improve her business. She is a well liked member of her communal bank. She always keeps the meetings in order.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Juan de 22, Julio de 20 y Michel de 4 años, a quienes mantiene sola, ya que lleva bastante tiempo separada de su esposo.

Con mucho esfuerzo logró levantarse de la caída de su tienda de maletas, la cual no pudo administrar por estar enferma, ahora según la demanda del mercado decidió instalar un centro de llamadas, el cual le ha resultado muy rentable y beneficioso, ya que también ha alquilado un local muy bien ubicado, donde son muchos los clientes que lo concurren.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y eso siempre les enseña a sus hijos, quienes cuando ella no está atienden el locutorio. Lleva un año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer por largas horas dentro de su local sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Carmen con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la solidaridad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará una nueva cabina de teléfono, para poder a tender a más clientes a la vez.
texts.en:
Carmen is a hard-working, 45 year-old woman who lives in her own house with her three children: Juan (22), Julio (20), and Michel (4). She takes care of them herself, as she has been separated from her husband for some time. With a lot of effort Carmen has managed to pick herself back up after the failure of her luggage store, which she had to close because of an illness. Now, to coincide with the demand of the market, she has decided to open a telephone call center, which has proven to be very profitable and beneficial. She has rented a site in a very good location that attracts a lot of customers. What Carmen likes the most about her work is taking care of her customers, a skill she always teaches to her children, as they run the store when she is out. After a year of working in this business, the hardest part for her is having to stay in the shop for long hours without being able to leave. Carmen hopes that in time her business will grow and be able to yield more profit. This is Carmen's ninth loan with MFP. She knows she has to make all her payments on time and is prepared to do it, as she does not want to hurt the other members of her communal bank, where she is well liked for the solidarity she shows. With these 1500 nuevos soles she will purchase a new telephone booth in order to serve more customers at one time.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a telephone booth

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
Ceferina, de 57 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora. Desde muy joven siempre trató de dar todo de sí para mejorar su calidad de vida. Actualmente vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alejo, de 57 años, y sus 4 hijos: Bertha de 32, Victor de 30, Victoria de 24 y Lizbeth de 19, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus papas, choclos y flores (gladiolos), los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra sola, ya que su esposo trabaja de albañil y muy pocas veces la puede apoyar en la siembra y cosecha. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el cultivo de alverja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende.

Este es el primer préstamo de Ceferina con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará los fungicidas que necesita para fumigar sus tierras, ya que no desea que sus sembríos se malogren por las plagas.
texts.en:
Cerefina, age 57, is a very hardworking woman. Since she was very young she has always tried to do all that she could to improve her quality of life. Currently, she lives in her own house with her husband Alejo, age 57, and their 4 children: Bertha, 32; Victor, 30; Victoria, 24; and Lizbeth, 19. What she wants most is to have a peaceful old age.

Working hard she has succeeded is making her fields prosper. Every morning, she wakes up early in order to water and provide care to her potatoes, corn, and flowers (gladiolas) which she will sell later in the city since it is there where she gets the best prices for her products.

What she likes most about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working in her green fields. She has carried on this business for 20 years and considers the most difficult part having to work the land alone. Her husband works as a bricklayer, and there is very little time in which he can help her with the planting and harvest. Eventually, she would like to adapt her land for the cultivation of peas since nowadays these sell better.

This is Cerefina’s first loan with MFP. She knows that this loan will help her in the progression and development of her business. That’s why she is determined to make all her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her community bank because it is very important to her. With the 500 new soles applied for she will buy fungicides that she needs to fumigate her fields since she doesn’t want her crops to be spoiled by diseases.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fungicides.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 50 años, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora; vive en su casa propia junto a su hija Betsy de 17 años y su esposo Abel de 54 años, quien trabaja junto con ella en la chacra, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, María pastea su ganado por las cumbres de los altos y verdes cerros de su poblado, gracias a este esfuerzo que diariamente realiza, su ganado está muy bien alimentado, motivo por el cual cuando los lleva a vender a la feria, son rápidamente comprados.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar a sus animales y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la ciudad, ya que sus animales son muy grandes y pesados. Para más adelante, desea incursionar en la agricultura, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de María en MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro, en su banco comunal, es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará forraje (pasto) para sus animales, con lo cual espera que puedan estar más sanos y fuertes.
texts.en:
María, age 50, is a tenacious and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 17 year old daughter, Betsy, and her 54 year old husband, Abel. She and her husband work together on the farm. What she wants most is to improve their quality of life. Everyday, very early in the morning, María takes the livestock to graze in the green hilltops of her village. Thanks to this daily effort, her livestock are very well fed. She does this so that they are rapidly purchased when she takes them to sell at the fair. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her animals, and she does this with great care. She has been doing this for 20 years. The most difficult part is transporting the livestock to the city because her animals are very large and heavy. In the future she wants to venture into agriculture in order to be able to improve her income. This is María’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time if she wants to have access to another loan in the future. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank and she's always well aware of the agreements reached by the group. She will use the 800 PEN that she has requested to buy grass for her animals, which she hopes will make them healthier and stronger.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her animals

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia, tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos de la cuales uno es independiente y dos todavía depende de ella (Naida de 20 años y Samira de 03 años). Octavia forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella se dedica a la venta de comida tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio que esta ubicado en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani y también vende gas, gaseosas y cerveza. Octavia nos cuenta que ya son 10 años se dedica a la venta de comida, gas y cerveza y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Octavia requiere el préstamo de los 2000 soles, que invertirá en comprar más arroz, azúcar, cerveza y gaseosa. Octavia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Octavia is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children, one of whom is independent and 2 still depend on her (Naida, 20 and Samira, 3). Octavia forms part of the communal bank 'Once de Mayo - Huancarani' of the Asociación Arariwa. She works selling food and has a small restaurant in her house which is located in the principal plaza of the city of Huancarani. She also sells gas, soft drinks and beer. Octavia tells us that she has sold food, gas, soft drinks and beer for 10 years and she has done very well, thanks to the determination she has in her work. Octavia requires a loan of 2000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of more rice, sugar, beer and soft drink. Octavia is thankful for the opportunity given to her and she promises to meet the payments according to the timeline. (The Peruvian district of Huancarani is one of the 6 districts in the province of Paucartambo, located in the department of Cusco, pertaining to the Cusco region, Perú).

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jessica Del Rocio

texts.es:
Jessica T. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y caña cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos, es soltera pero esta embarazada. 

Jessica empezó con una mesa de madera vendiendo aretes y cuadernos a las fuera de su casa, poco a poco ahorro dinero y puso una pequeña papelería en su casa.

Ahora Jessica trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días, vende lápices por caja, cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc. Una de las complicaciones en el negocio es la delincuencia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, arena para arreglar su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda que tenga todo lo que el cliente pida.
texts.en:
