Jessica T., 35 years old, lives in a semi-urban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made from cement and cane, and has basic services including water and light. She is single but is pregnant. Jessica began with a wooden table where she sold art and paintings outside her house, little by little saving money, and then installed a small stationery shop in her house. Now Jessica works from 7am until 8pm every day. She sells boxes of pens, notebooks, pens, laminate sheets etc. One of the complications of her business is the delinquency. With the loan she wants to buy cement, stone, and sand to rennovate her business. In the future she wants to have a shop where she has all that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, sand and stone

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa, tiene 26 años, es conviviente y  tiene dos hijos, ella forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. Felipa y su esposo Julio se dedican a la producción de ropa de lana como chompas, pantalones, polos, ropa interior y chalinas. Felipa y su esposo tienen un taller de confección  de ropa en su domicilio donde también se vende la ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedican al negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Felipa requiere el préstamo de los 1000 soles, que invertirá en comprar lana.  Felipa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Felipa is 26 years old, lives with her husband, and has two children. She is a member of the Asociación Arariwa’s “Once de Mayo – Huancarani” communal bank. Felipa and her husband, Julio, make wool clothing, such as jackets, pants, sweaters, underclothes, and shawls. Felipa and her husband have a clothing workshop in their house, where they also sell the clothing. They have been in this business for several years and it has gone well for them because of the effort they put into their work. Felipa needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy wool. Felipa is grateful for the opportunity provided through this program and she promises to repay in within the time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Felipa needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy wool.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, tiene 41 años, es casada y  tiene seis hijos, ella forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. Julia se dedica a la confección de ropa de lana como chompas, pantalones, polos, ropa interior y chalinas. Julia nos cuenta que ella produce de forma manual su ropa en su domicilio donde también se vende la ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedican al negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Julia requiere el préstamo de los 1000 soles, que invertirá en comprar lana.  Julia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old, married, and has six children. She is a member of the Asociación Arariwa’s “Once de Mayo – Huancarani” communal bank. Julia makes wool clothing, such as jackets, pants, sweaters, underclothes, and shawls. Julia tells us she makes her clothing by hand in her home, which is also where she sells the clothing. She has been in this business for several years and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Julia needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy wool. Julia is grateful for the opportunity provided through this program and she promises to repay in within the time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy wool.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela, de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Vive en una casa de adobe (propia), junto a sus 3 hijos: Jerson de 18, Yosida de 12 y Lady de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene en su chacra le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia, ya que desde que su esposo falleció, hace 7 años, ella es el único sustento de su familia y tiene que velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, es por eso que trabaja en todo lo que puede, ya que también está en el negocio de la crianza de cuyes y cerdos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cuidar sus papas y alverjas, pues sabe que esos productos se venden a mejor precio, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros del poblado donde tiene sus chacras. Para el futuro, espera mejorar su producción y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras.

Este es el primer préstamo de Marianela con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que pone en las reuniones. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará pesticidas y herbicidas, para cuidar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marianela is 37 years old and is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in an adobe house (her own), together with her 3 children: Jerson, 18, Yosida, 12, and Lady, 6, who are the motives for all her hard work. The arduous working days she has on her farm have helped her improve the economic situation of her family since her husband died 7 years ago. She is the only person who sustains her family and has to watch over the well-being of her children. It is for this reason that she works at everything she can, including her business of breeding guinea pigs and pigs. What Marianela likes most about her work is caring for her potatoes and peas, as she knows that the products can be sold at a good price. She has done this activity for 17 years and considers that the most difficult thing is having to climb the steep slopes of the town where she has her farm. In the future, she hopes to improve her production and sew crops throughout all of her land. This is Marianela's first loan with MFP and she is disposed to make all her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to be in debt and damage her communal bank, where she is much loved for the energy and happiness she brings to the meetings. With the 700 nuevos soles she is seeking she will buy pesticides and herbicides to look after her seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, de 24 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredó su abuelita, junto a su esposo Orestes de 25 años y su querida hija Ivet de 4 años, a quien desea dar una mejor calidad de vida.

Trabajando arduamente junto a su esposo, Rosmery ha logrado sacar adelante su hogar. Los sembríos que con tanto esfuerzo ha cultivado, apenas le brindan el dinero necesario para cubrir los gastos que tiene su familia, es por eso que también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, siendo esta actividad la que principalmente realiza, ya que le brinda mejores ingresos económicos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus cerdos, puesto que mientras más gordos estén mejores ganancias le darán. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es vender sus cerdos a los comerciantes que los matan para vender su carne. Para más adelante, espera comprar una camioneta, con al cual pueda transportar sus animales hasta la ciudad, ya que cree que podría conseguir mejores precios.

Este es el primer préstamo de Rosmery con MFP, sabe que tiene que saber invertir en su negocio si quiere progresar. A su vez, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y querida, ya que siempre demuestra mucha responsabilidad. Rosmery invertirá la mitad del dinero que solicita en fumigar sus chacras y la otra mitad en comprar alimento para sus cerdos.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 24 years old and is a very happy and hard-working young lady. She lives in the house she inherited from her grandmother together with her husband Orestes, 25 and her beloved daughter, Ivet, 4, tow hom she wants to give a better quality of life. Working very hard together with her husband Rosmery has managed to move her household forward. The crops that she has cultivated with such hard work hardly give her the money necessary to cover the costs of her home, and for this reason she also breeds pigs, this being the main activity that she does as it gives her better economic results. What she likes most about her work is feeding her pigs, as the fatter they are the better earnings they give her. She has been doing this activity for 4 years and considers the most difficult thing to be selling her pigs to storekeepers who kill them to sell the meat. In the future she hopes to buy a truck with which she can transport her animals to the city, as she believes she can obtain better prices there. This is Rosmery's first loan with MFP. She knows she has to invest money in her business if she wants it to progress. She is a very happy and beloved member of her communal bank and has always demonstrated great responsbility. Rosmery will invest half of the money that she is seeking in fumigating her farm and the other half in buying food for her pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fumigate farm and purchase food for pigs

loans.name: Washington Eduardo

texts.es:
Washington C. de 42 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 2 hijas.  

Washington hace 3 años empezó con una computadora haciendo trabajos para oficinas, poco a poco ahorro dinero y pudo comprar dos impresoras para tener más clientes.

Ahora el trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00, haciendo trabajos de computadoras, impresiones a color / blanco-negro y escáner. Una de las dificultades es el espacio físico de su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, bloques para ya tener un lugar fijo de trabajo. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de Cibercafé.
texts.en:
Washington C. is 42 years old and lives in an urban zone of Suburbio de Guayaquil. He has a cement house with the basic services of water and light. His wife is a house wife and with her he has 2 daughters. 3 years ago Washington began with 1 computer doing work for offices, little by little saving money until he could buy 2 printers to have more clients. Now he works every day from 7am until 8pm, doing computer work, printing in black and white and colour, and scanning. One of the difficulties he finds is the physical space his business needs. With the loan Washington wants to buy cement, stones and blocks to have a stable working space. In the future he wants to have a branch of Cibercafé.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, stones and blocks

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Laura S. es de la Comarca de Cofradía, ella trabaja como profesora de primaria en la escuela Rubén Darío ella tiene de laborar ya veinte años,  el crédito ella lo ocupara para consumo personal, como por ejemplo pago de matricula de su hija que va a la universidad, comprarle los libros ya que son muy caros. Doña Laura se acerca a  CEPRODEL para que le  ayude en el bienestar de  su familia, brindar un nivel de vida mejor a sus hijos, y así  sacarlos adelante en sus estudio.
texts.en:
Laura S. is from Cofradía. She is an elementary school teacher at Rubén Darío school; she has been working for 20 years. She will use the funds for personal expenses like her daughter's university tuition and to buy her some textbooks, which are very expensive. Laura approaces CEPRODEL to seek help for her family's wellbeing, to provide a better quality of life for her children, and to provide an education for them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For college tuition and to buy books.

loans.name: Rosa Elina

texts.es:
La señor Rosa Elina T. A.  es originaria de la comunidad de buenos aires ubicada en la parte norte de Estelí su principal actividad es la agricultura y una pequeña pulpería que tiene se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de un panel solar ya que en su lugar no hay energía eléctrica por lo que es de gran utilidad para ella el uso del panel solar 

Doña Rosa todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos con su esposo y ha mejorado sus ingresos gracias al esfuerzo de toda su familia. Ella espera que el panel solar le sirva de mucho porque ya no tendrá que alumbrar con candelas ni lámparas además tiene la posibilidad de poner un televisor y mirar las noticias.
Su finca cuenta con un área de 40 mz aproximadamente donde 7 de estas son agrícolas también posee una pequeña cantidad de ganado donde también obtiene sus ingresos en venta de novillos y lácteos.
Rosa Elina es casada y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad y le brindan su ayuda cuando ella los necesita. Este es segundo crédito que tiene con ceprodel en un periodo de dos años y expresa que desea seguir trabajando ya que los créditos que ha tenido le han ayudado a crecer y mejorar su nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Rosa Elina T. A. is from the Buenos Aires area in the north part of Estelí. She is a farmer but also has a small grocery store. She was given funding to buy a solar panel because there is no electricity in her place so a solar panel will be of great usefulness fo her. Rosa has always farmed basic grains with her husband and has improved their earnings thanks to the efforts of the entire family. She hopes that the solar panel will be of much use because she won't have to provide light with candles or lamps any longer; besides, she now will have the opportunity to install a television set and watch the news. Her farm measures approximately 40 manzanas (a traditional Central American land measure), 7 of which are used for farming. She also has a small herd of cattle that also produces some income through the sale of calves and dairy products. Rosa Elina is married and has 4 adult children; they help her out when she needs them. This is her second loan with CEPRODEL in a period of two years; she states that she wants to continue working because the loans that she has had have helped to grow and improve her family's living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes del Carmen G. H. trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería en un centro de salud, su estado civil es casada, por su amplia experiencia  se desempeña como responsable de vigilancia de epidemiología, con la institución tiene muchos años de trabajar y los créditos que ha solicitado han sido para la obtención de una fuente de ingresos extras que le ayuden a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes del Carmen G. H. works as a nursing assistant at a health center. She is married. Because of her extensive experience, she is responsible for epidemiological surveillance and has been with the institution for many years. The loans that she has requested are for obtaining another source of income that will help improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Angelica Isabel

texts.es: Angelica tiene 20 años es soltera, estudio hasta el 5o grado y lleva 5 años dedicada a la produccion de calzado junto con su madre y sus hermanos. Ahora ha acudido a ASDIR para solicitar un credito para poder comprar dos herramientas para la fabricacion de zapato. Con esta actividad ella y su familia han logrado estabilizarse economicamente.
texts.en:
Angelica is 20 years old and single. She went to school until the fifth grade. She has been making footwear with her mother and her siblings for five years. She has now come to ASDIR to request a loan to be able to buy two tools for making shoes. She and her family have been able to stabilize themselves economically through this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for making shoes

loans.name: Benita Lorena

texts.es:
La  señora Benita Lorena Ríos S. es comerciante desde hace veinte años su negocio está ubicado frente al boulevard del bisne tiene cinco años de trabajar con créditos, ha demostrado ser una señora emprendedora con deseos de superación.   

    La señora Ríos S. es soltera tiene tres hijos todos a su cargo y estudian.
texts.en:
Benita Lorena Ríos S. has been a merchant for the last 20 years. Her business is located in front of El Bisne boulevard. She has managed loans for five years and has demonstrated being an enterprising woman that has a wish to succeed. Mrs. Ríos S. is single and has three children, who are students, under her care.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials: fruit, rice, beans.  Ingredients for meals: cooking oil, sugar.

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Omar De Jesús R. R. labora como oficial de registro, es padre de cuatro hijos tres en edades escolares. Este crédito lo solicito para la mejora de su vivienda ya que con su salario un pueden realizar mejoras en su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Omar De Jesús R. R. works as a clerk in a government registry. He is the father of four children, three of whom are of school age. This loan is applied for in order to improve his home since he cannot bring about such improvements with his salary.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, zinc, and concrete blocks

loans.name: Mirella Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora  Mirella R. labora como maestra de primaria en una escuela de la comarca de Cofradía para poder subsistir y dar lo mejor a sus hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito en CEPRODEL para la compra de útiles escolares y libros que utilizaran sus hijos y así poderles dar las herramientas en su preparación para hacer de ellos personas de bien
texts.en:
Mirella R. teaches elementary school in Cofradía in order to support herself and give the best to her children. She is asking CEPRODEL for funding to buy school supplies and text books that her children will use so that she can give them the tools they need for their preparation in order that they may become upstanding citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and textbooks.

loans.name: Sixto Regalado

texts.es: El Sr. Sixto Regalado Méndez Solís trabaja como ayudante de mantenimiento, es padre de dos hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar, los créditos que ha solicitado con CEPRODEL  han sido para ampliación y reparación de su vivienda, este es su tercer crédito con la institución y dice sentirse satisfecho con los servicios que se le brindan.
texts.en:
Sixto Regalado Méndez Solís works as a maintenance assistant. He is the father of two children, one of whom is of school age. The loans he has requested from CEPRODEL have been used to repair and enlarge his home. This is his third loan with the institution and he says that he is satisfied with the services they provide him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, stone, zinc metal sheeting, concrete blocks.

loans.name: Remove

texts.es: REMOVE L.
texts.en:
They are hard-working people who make garments like t-shirts and pants, among others. They have been doing this for over five years. It is the strongest source of income in the community. They all sell their products in the San Francisco El Alto municipality, which is 25 kilometers from the community. They currently need a L.. They have come to the ASDIR Association to be able to get the financing. They have grouped together so that the cost of selling their products is lower. That way they get better earnings, and at the same time they are able to increase the capital that each one of them manages.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: REMOVE LOAN

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
La  señora Leyla A. C. es casada tiene cuatro  hijos ninguno a su cargo es comerciante desde hace dieciséis años, se dedica a la venta de frijoles cosidos cose a diario 25 libras de frijoles y se tarda en venderlos  un día,  vive con su esposo en el barrio san Agustín.
La señora A. se le han otorgado veintiséis créditos para mantener estable su negocio desde hace seis años que tiene de trabajar  con CEPRODEL
texts.en:
Mrs. Leyla A. C. is married with four grown children. She has been a merchant for 16 years, selling cooked beans. She cooks 25 pounds of beans daily and takes a day to sell them. She lives with her husband in the neighborhood of San Agustin. Mrs. A. has been given 26 loans to keep her business steady during the six years she has been working with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials, beans, and firewood

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es: El Sr. José  Samuel C. R. su estado civil casado, padre de dos hijos uno en edad escolar, trabaja como técnico operador de equipos pesados, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de un terreno que luego construirá su casa  poco a poco es decir con cada crédito que le ofrezca la institución.
texts.en:
José Samuel C. R. is married and has two children, one of whom is of school age. He works as a technical operator of heavy equipment. The funds will be used to buy a lot on which he will gradually build his house; that is, with each successive loan the institution grants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Eugenio Ramón O. S.. Es comerciante desde hace cincuenta años desempeñándose como joyero profesional en el sector joyerías del mercado bisne. 

El señor O. es casado tiene tres hijos solo una vive con el por qué es minusválida. el crédito otorgado lo utilizara para compra de materia prima, para cubrir unos encargos que le solicitan sus clientes. El señor O. inicio a trabajar con Ceprodel desde que inicio en el mercado el bisne.
texts.en:
Eugenio Ramón O. S. has been a merchant for 50 years; he has been a professional jeweler in the jewelry section of the El Bisne market. Mr. O. is married and has three children; only one of whom still lives with him because she is disabled. He will use the loan to buy raw materials to fill some orders he has from customers. Mr. O. has been collaborating with CEPRODEL since he started in the El Bisne market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, tiene 41 años y es casada, ella forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. Julia se dedica a la venta de comida como caldo de gallina y caldo de cabeza de cordero. Julia nos cuenta que compra dos a tres gallinas de sus vecinas para hacer sus caldos. Ya son varios años que se dedican al negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Julia requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles, que invertirá en comprar mas gallinas para hacer mas platos de comida. Julia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old and is married. She is a member of the Asociación Arariwa’s “Once de Mayo – Huancarani” communal bank. Julia sells food, such as chicken soup and lamb’s head soup. Julia tells us she buys two or three chickens from her neighbors to make her soups. She has been in this business for several years and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Julia needs a loan of 500 PEN, which she will use to buy more chickens for the food she makes. Julia is grateful for the opportunity provided through this program and she promises to repay in within the time frame. (The Peruvian district of Huancarani is one of the 6 districts in the province of Paucartambo, located in the department of Cusco. It belongs to Cusco Region, Peru.)

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 500 PEN, which she will use to buy more chickens for the food she makes.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: El Sr. José Domingo P. S. es de oficio carpintero y se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, padre de cuatro hijos dos en edad escolares, este crédito lo solicito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, en los tiempos libres se dedica a elaborar muebles y de esta forma obtener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
José Domingo P. S. is a carpenter and works as a security guard. He is the father of four children, two of whom are school aged. He will use the funds to make improvements to his home; on his free time he likes to make furniture to earn extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, zind metal sheeting, concrete blocks and sand.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Bertha Alicia tiene un taller  de Costura en su casa que está ubicada en el municipio del viejo.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito para comprar telas hilos, tijeras, etc. Ya que le encargaron 30 uniformes   para niños.
Además trabaja como asalariada en una escuela de personas especiales de miércoles a sábado, para recibir un mayor ingreso.
Ella dice que con el crédito que  le brinde CEPRODEL,  podrá hacer todos los uniformes necesarios que tiene encargados y para vender por aparte, además dice estar muy agradecida con la institución ya que con estos 4 créditos que ha tenido ha podido comprar otra máquina y electrométricos que utiliza en el hogar.
texts.en:
Bertha Alicia has a tailoring workshop in her home, which is located in the Del Viejo municipality. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread, etc. because she has 30 children's school uniforms on order. She also works as a salaried employee, from Wednesday to Saturday, at a school for persons with special needs to earn extra income. She states that with the funds that CEPRODEL provides her she will be able to make all the uniforms that she has on order and some additional ones to sell separately. She also states that she is very grateful to the institution because these four loans have made it possible for her to buy another sewing machine and some home appliances that she uses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, sewing machine needles, scissors, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Chirrojop Group

texts.es: Son un grupo de personas que se dedican a la confeccion de ropas de vestir tales como pantalones, chumpas, playeras, y entre otras prendas, desde hace más de 2 años cuentan con experiencia lo que hace que en el tiempo necesitan más capital de trabajo, por esa razón han acudido a las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, a presentar una solicitud de prestamo para el aumento de capital de trabajo, y de esa manera podrán obtener mejores ganancias,asi también mejorar sus condiciones de vida para su familia, esta actividad ayuda a la comunidad con los costos bajos de sus productos muchas personas se benefician y logran desarrollar una actividad
texts.en:
They are a group of people who are dedicated to making clothing such as trousers, jackets, and shirts, among other items. They have over two years' experience with what they do, which they now need more working capital for. For this reason, they have approached the offices of the ASDIR Association to present a loan request for an expansion of working capital. In this manner, they will be able to obtain better earnings and also improve the living conditions for their families. This activity helps the community with low prices for their products. Many people benefit and are able to develop an activity.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Ivania Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra.  Ivania F. vende productos de la AVON por catalogo y vende frijoles cocidos en su casa que está ubicada en el municipio del viejo.
Ella va a utilizar este crédito para comprar productos de la AVON como perfumes, pinturas labiales, etc.   (Pedido encargado).
Ella es madre soltera y vive sola ya que su hija vive fuera del país, pero ella le manda remesas mensuales para ayudar a su mama.
Ivania dijo que sus créditos con CEPRODEL,  han ayudado mucho a crecer en su negocio y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ivania F. sells AVON catalogue products; she also sells cooked beans in her home, which is located in the El Viejo municipality. She will use the funds to buy AVON products like: perfumes, lipsticks, etc. (Placed Order) She is a single mother who lives alone because her daughter lives abroad; she sends monthly allowances to help out her mother. Ivania said that her loans with CEPRODEL have been of much use to her in that they helped her business grow and improve her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Avon products.

loans.name: Elsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elsa Gómez de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una constructora.

Elsa empezó hace 5 años haciendo carteras y billeteras tejidas. Esta actividad la aprendió de su mama cuando ella era muy pequeña. 

Ahora ella vende carteras, billeteras, ropa, manteles tejidos a mano. También vende artículos para el hogar Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días. Una de las complicaciones que tiene son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos, cierres para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda y enseñar a confeccionar con tejidos.
texts.en:
Elsa Gómez is 35 years old. She lives in a suburban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement but only has light as a basic service. Her husband works as a construction worker. Five years ago, Elsa began making woven handbags and wallets. She learned this activity from her mother when she was young. Now she sells handbags, wallets, clothing and tablecloths woven by hand. She also sells articles for the home. She works from 7AM until 8PM every day. One of the complications that she faces is the rains. With the loan, she wants to buy fabric, yarns and zippers for her business. In the future, she wishes to have a store and teach how to make woven products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, yarn and zippers.

loans.name: Miguel Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel Cárdenas G. es trabajador activo de la alcaldía municipal es el responsable del área de transporte,  el dinero lo solicita para compra de una moto-taxi, casado tiene 4 hijos uno menor.
texts.en:
Miguel Cárdenas G. is an employee of the Mayor's office transportation department. He will use the funds to buy a mototaxi. He is married and has four children, one of whom is still a minor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.es:
El señor Inocencio S. tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda, pero le está haciendo falta algunas detalles, para el lo mas importante por el momento son las barda, ya que trabaja gran parte del día y quiere la seguridad para su familia.
Es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo y así poder elaborar las bardas alrededor de la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con sus ingresos que obtiene de su empleo en un restauran de mariscos en el departamento de cocina. 
Inocencio S. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Inocencio S. has achieved home ownership in little time but he is lacking certain details. The most important item at the moment is the fence since he works for a great part of the day and wants to keep his family secure. It is for this reason that he is requesting the loan and be able build a fence around his house. He plans to pay the loan with his earnings that he obtains from his kitchen job in a seafood restaurant. Inocencio S. has already had two loans with FVP which he paid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence in front of his house.

loans.name: Antonia Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Antonia Lorena V., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como operaria de limpieza, ella es casada con cinco hijos de los cuales solo uno tiene a cargo, tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel lo cual le ha beneficiado para salir adelante con su familia.

La señora V. utilizara el préstamo para terminar de alistar a sus hijos para las clases y también comprara un zinc para reparar una parte del techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Antonia Lorena V. works for Chinandega's Mayor's office as a cleaning lady. She is married and has five children, of whom only one is still dependent on her. She has collaborated with CEPRODEL for three years and this has been useful to her to get ahead in life with her family. She will use the funds to finish getting her children ready for classes and will also buy some zinc metal sheeting to repair part of her roof.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Juan Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El joven Juan Francisco Javier G. tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose al oficio de soldador. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta una maquina para saldar. Solicita el préstamo para poder realizar la comprar ya que lo puede obtener a un buen precio.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco Javier G. already has more than two years' experience in the role of welder. His business is lacking a cash register. He is requesting a loan in order to buy one since he can obtain one at a good price. He plans to pay the loan with the earnings he obtains from his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cash register.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
La Señora Isabel Reyna V. tiene una venta de tortilla en su casa ella misma las fabrica y las vende allí mismo en casa de habitación de iglesia san Agustín 2 1/2c al sur, lleva veintidós créditos y ha sido excelente paga, es soltera, tiene tres hijos, pero ninguno depende de ella.
La señora V., ha sido emprendedora, muy responsable, el crédito lo solicita para comprar su materia prima ( Maíz) por quintal y así obtiene mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel Reyna V. is a tortilla merchant; she sells the tortillas that she, herself, makes in her home, which is located two-and-a-half blocks south from St. Augustine church. She has managed loans for 22 years and she has always been excellent with her repayments. She is single and has three children but none of them still depend on her. Mrs. V. has been enterprising and very responsible. She will use the funds to buy raw materials (corn) by the quintal (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) so that her profits will be higher.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the school and buy educational materials.

loans.name: Grace Santa

texts.es:
Grace R. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja en otro País, pero tiene 4 hijos que viven con ella.

Grace empezó hace 5 años atrás vendiendo cuadernos y plumas a sus vecinos. Cuando ahorro dinero suficiente construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño local para su papelería.

Ahora ella trabaja todo los días desde las 06h30 hasta las 21h00 todos los días vendiendo cuadernos, juguetes, plumas, laminas, cartulinas, etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene son las lluvias que hay en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, juguetes y libros para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su papelería.
texts.en:
Grace R. is 43 years old. She lives in a suburban area of Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement but she has only light as a basic service. Her husband works in another country but she has four children who live with her. Grace began five years ago selling notebooks and pens to her neighbors. When she saved enough money, she built a small paper shop in the area behind her house. Now she works every day from 6:30AM until 9PM selling notebooks, games, pens, sheets, cardstock, etc. One of the inconveniences that she faces is the rains that occur in her area. With the loan, she wishes to buy notebooks, pens, games and books for he business. In the future, she wants to have branches of her paper shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, pens and games.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor Rodríguez O. el se desempeña como acarreador de arena de una bloquera ubicada en somotillo  es de ahí donde el señor sacas las cuotas para el pago del crédito.
El a tenido 2 créditos con nuestra institución los cuales los cancelo en tiempo y forma sin retraso alguno Jorge nos dice que los créditos con CEPRODEL lo han ayudado mucho a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodríguez O. works as a sand hauler for a concrete block factory located in Somotillo. His salary provides the money to repay the loan. He has had two previous loans with our institution which he repaid on time with no delays. Jorge tells us that CEPRODEL's loans have been very helpful to him in accomplishing improvements to his life and to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement.

loans.name: Santos Andres

texts.es:
El señor A. V. es trabajador active de la escuela de la comarca santa teresa desempeñándose como maestro nos solicita el crédito para la compra de cemento para realizar el repello a su casa de habitación y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida de el y de su familia.
El a tenido dos créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales los cancelo en  tiempo y forma sin retraso alguno.
texts.en:
Mr. A. V. actively works as a teacher in the Santa Teresa regional school . He is asking for a loan to buy cement to finish the waterproofing of his home, so that he can improve the living conditions for his family. He has had loans with CEPRODEL in the past that he paid on time, and without any delays.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement to waterproof his home and to fix a wall there as well.

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es:
La señora A. Gómez trabaja como vendedora ambulante de cosméticos en el municipio de somotillo nos esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de cemento para repellar su casa de habitación y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella ha tenido 2 créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales los cancelo antes de la fecha estipulada de cancelación.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. Gómez works as a door-to-door cosmetics salesperson in Somotillo. She is asking for funding to buy cement to plaster her house thereby improving her living conditions. She has had two loans with CEPRODEL which she repaid ahead of time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement to plaster the house and paint to paint it.

loans.name: Luz Del Trancito

texts.es:
La señora Rodríguez es trabajadora activa de la escuela san Ignacio del o yola de la ciudad de somotillo.
Ella nos solicita el crédito para comprar pintura y pintar su casa de habitación y así mejorar sus condiciones de ella y de su familia.
Es madre de tres hijos los cuales están bajo su tutela ellos son menores de edad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rodríguez is an active worker in San Ignatius Loyola School in the city of Somotillo.

She needs this loan to buy paint and to paint her home and thereby improve her living conditions and those of her family.

She is a mother to 3 children, who are under her care and are underage.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint to paint her home.

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.es: EL señor M. Z. trabaja como zapatero en un taller situado en su casa de habitación el nos solicita el crédito para comprar parte de hierro para levantar una pieza en su casa y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. M. Z., works as a shoemaker in a workshop in his home, he needs the loan to buy iron to make a room in his home and in this way improve the living conditions of himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy iron to improve his home.

loans.name: Osiris Mileyda

texts.es:
La señora L. A. realiza sus ventas de bebidas en un quiosco situado en las orias de un colegio de secundaria ella solicita el crédito a CEPRODEL para aumentar su inventario de productos y de esta manera generar mas ingresos al hogar.
Ella es madre de 5 hijos los cuales viven con ella nos dice que los créditos con CEPRODEL la han beneficiado mucho para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. L. A. sells her refreshments in a kiosk located on the outskirts of a high school. She needs the loan from CEPRODEL (Kiva’s field partner) to increase her inventory of products and in this way get more income for her home.

She is a mother to 5 children, all live with her and she tells us that the loans with CEPRODEL have helped her improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize for her refreshment business and candy for her students.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es:
La señora Velásquez E. vende sus productos ahorrías de un colegio el cual con este crédito lo ampliara para tener productos variados para todos los gustos.
Ella es madre de dos hijos los cuales están bajo su tutela todavía ella expone que el crédito con CEPRODEL le ayudara a obtener mayores ingresos a su familia y de esta manera tener una mejor vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Velásquez E. sells her merchandise alongside a school. She will use these funds to expand her inventory in order to have products available for all tastes. She is the mother of two children who are still under her care. She states that CEPRODEL funds will help her earn more income for her family and this will improve the family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora C. López se desempeña en el trabajo de distribuidora de ropa y zapatos por mayor alos minoristas de mercado municipal de somotillo.
Ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales están bajo su tutela nos expone que el crédito con CEPRODEL la a beneficiado a amentar su inventario de mercadería y de esta manera aumento sus ingresos monetarios para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. López sells clothing and shoes at wholesale to retailers in Somotillo's municipal market. She is the mother of 4 children, who are still under her care. CEPRODEL's funding has made it possible for her to increase her stock inventory so that her monetary earnings for her family are higher.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, like shoes, among others.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor E. S. trabaja como triciclero en la ciudad de somotillo acarreando personas a donde se lo soliciten también cargas de todo tipo.
Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de cemento para dar repello a su casa.
El a tenido 6 crédito los cuales los cancelo antes de tiempo es el séptimo que nos solicita.
texts.en:
Señor E. S. works as a “triciclero” (someone who transports persons or goods via tricycle) in the city of Somotillo. He carries people to where they ask to go and also cargo of all types.

He is applying for this loan in order to buy cement for plastering his house. He has had six loans which he has paid off before they were due. This is the seventh loan which he has applied for from us.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement for plastering his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raquel Ivania

texts.es:
La señora Raquel Ivania es trabajadora de una tienda donde se vende y se elaboran vestidos de damas para toda ocasión destacándose como estilista esta tienda es en Esteli.
Raquel va usar el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción. Ella espera que con la compra de los materiales pueda construir un cuarto de las siguientes medida de 4 metros ancho por 4 metros largos.
Raquel es casada y tiene dos hijos  a su cargo ambos en edad escolar.
Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel Raquel dice que sus créditos han sido de mucha importancia ya que ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel Ivania works in a store where they sell and make women’s clothing for all occasions and she stands out as a stylist in this store that is in Esteli.

Raquel will use the loan to buy construction materials. She hopes that by buying the materials she will be able to build a room of the following measurements: 4 meters wide by 4 meters long.

Raquel is married and has 2 children under her care, both are of school age.

This is her second loan with Ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner), Raquel says that the loans have been very important and they have improved her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials like:  sand, bricks, tiles, cement, zinc, iron, etc.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor Jose C. es trabajador de la universidad UNAN en Esteli trabajando como guarda de seguridad.
Jose va usar este crédito para la compra de una motocicleta quiere que con su moto pueda transportarse al trabajo.
Jose es casado y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Este es el segundo crédito con Ceprodel ha trabajado por dos años con Ceprodel.
Jose dijo que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han sido de mucha importancia ya que ha pagado deuda y ha comprado algunas cosas para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose C. works in the UNAN University in Esteli, working as a security guard.

Jose will use the loan to buy a motorcycle and hopes that with it he will be able to travel to and from work.

Jose is married and has 2 children under his care. This is his second loan with Ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner) he has worked for two years with the institution.

Jose says that his loans with Ceprodel have been very important since he paid his debt and has bought some things for his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Antonio G. es trabajador de un casino en el casco urbano de  la ciudad de Esteli en el área de administración.
Juan va usar este crédito para pagar los gastos universitarios de su hijo ya que va ingresar ala universidad como nuevo ingreso.
El espera que con los pago de los gasto universitario su hijo pueda estudiar ya si poder formar un profesional.
Juan es acompañado y tiene dos hijos a su cargo y ambos en edad escolar.
Este es su cuarto crédito y tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel, Juan dijo que su crédito le han ayudado mucho ya que con los créditos anteriores lo ha invertido en un pequeño negocio de frutas en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Antonio G. works in a casino in the city of Esteli in the administration area.

Juan will use this loan to pay the university expenses of his son since he will begin his studies as a freshman.

He hopes that with paying the university expenses of his son, he will be able to study and become a professional.

Juan is in a common-law marriage and has 2 sons in his care, both are of school age.

This is his fourth loan and has worked with Ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner) for 3 years. Juan says that his loans have helped him a lot since with the previous loans he invested in a small business selling fruits in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his son’s university school fees like registration, enrollment and other.

loans.name: Aracely  Aydalina

texts.es:
La Licenciada Aracely R. es trabajadora  de una micro financiera que lleva por nombre TU CREDITO en Esteli ella trabaja como promotora de crédito.
Aracely va usar el crédito para la compra de una cocina para la elaboración de hot dog y hamburguesa ya que en su casa hay un negocio de venta de comida.
Ella espera que con la cocina se ha de mucha  importancia ya que le permite preparar los alimento mas rápido.
Aracely es casada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Este es su tercer crédito y lleva dos años trabajando con Ceprodel .Ella dice que los crédito anteriores le han sido de mucha importancia ya que ha comprado algunos electrodomésticos para su casa.
texts.en:
College graduate Aracely R. works at a microfinance institution called TU CREDITO ("Your Loan") in Esteli. She works as a loan sales representative. Aracely will use the loan for purchase of a cooker for making hot dogs and hamburgers, since she has a food sale business in her house. She expects the cooker to be very important since it will allow her to prepare foods more quickly. Aracely is married and has a school-age son. This is her third loan, and she has been working with Ceprodel for two years. She says the previous loans have been very important to her since she has bought some electrical appliances for her house.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooker for preparation of hot dogs and hamburgers

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo Wilder de 39 años, y con sus 4 hijos: Kenyo de 14, Erick de 9, Jovali de 5 años y Roy de 7 meses. Esta familia habita en su acogedora casa propia ubicada en lo alto de la sierra del Perú, lugar denominado Cayan.  

Desde muy temprano, con su bebé a la espalda sujeto con una manta de tela, Adela trabaja en sus cultivos de papa, arveja y habas. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo, ambos siembran desde hace 14 años y por sí solos aprendieron las técnicas agrícolas para hacer producir en mayor cantidad sus productos. Lo que más le gusta a ella es la cosecha de los tubérculos, caminado detrás del arado que domina su pareja recogiendo los productos en una manta amarrada a su cintura. Paralelamente cría dos toros, tres ovejas y dos cerdos.
Los días libres su esposo trabaja como operario en otras chacras, dinero que se destina para cubrir los gastos domiciliarios, lo cual les permite vivir cómodamente.
Con el tiempo, Adela desea dedicarse a la venta de queso o de ropa por los diferentes lugares aledaños de su ciudad.

Este es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y entusiasmada dice que trabajará activamente para mejorar el desarrollo de su banco comunal, pues luego de tantos créditos ya aprendió la metodología del grupo. En su zona se ingresan a la campaña de siembra, es por eso con el dinero que solicita comprará 40 sacos de semilla de papa, con lo restante desea adquirir abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Adela is 32 years old. She lives with her husband, Wilder, who is 39 years old, and their four children: Kenyo who is 14, Erick who is 9, Jovali who is 5 and Roy who is 7 months. This family lives in an inviting home of their own located in the high sierras of Peru, a place named Cayan. Starting early, with her baby on her back with a blanket, Adela works with her crops of potato, peas and beans. She completes this activity alongside her husband. Both have farmed for 14 years and learned agricultural tricks on their own in order to produce a greater quantity of products. What she likes the most is the harvest of root vegetables, walking behind the plow that her husband drives, picking up the products with a blanket tied around her waist. At the same time, they raise two bulls, three sheep and two pigs. On free days, her husband works as an operator in other fields earning money that is destined to cover the bills which allows them to live comfortably. In time, Adela wishes to dedicate herself to selling cheese or clothing in different places around her city. This is the tenth loan that they have had with MFP and she enthusiastically says that she will work actively to improve the development of her community bank since, after so many loans, she has learned the group's methodology. In her area, they are going into planting season. It is for this that she will buy 40 sacks of potato seed with the money. With the rest, she wishes to acquire fertilizers and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Amalio

texts.es:
Amalio tiene 29 años, está casado con Reina de 25 años, con quien tiene un hijo, Brandon de 5 años. Esta hermosa familia vive en su casa propia en la sierra central del Perú.

Desde hace 15 años está dedicado a la siembra de papa, y con las ganancias de esta actividad logró comprar sus propios terrenos de cultivo, construir su pequeña vivienda y solventar las necesidades de su familia. Su esposa le ayuda en las actividades diarias, es quien administra el dinero, pues están ahorrando para comprar una casa más grande y mejor construida en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, donde desean instalar una tienda de comestibles.
Ahora está concentrado en sembrar mayor cantidad, por lo que piensa usar sus nuevos terrenos para un diferente tipo de papa, es cual es más resistente a la estación de verano que se que se avecina, pues no habrá lluvia y las tierras estarán secas.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y manifiesta que le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal porque está conformado por personas responsables y muy puntuales en cada pago. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar una bolsa de semilla de arveja y 35 sacos de semilla de papa.
texts.en:
Amalio is 29 years old and is married to 25 year old Reina, with whom he has one 5 year old son, Brandon. This lovely family lives in their own home in the central mountains of Perú. For the last 15 years he has cultivated potatoes. With the earnings from this business he has been able to buy his own fields, build a small house and cover the needs of his family. His wife helps him with the daily activities and manages their money. Actually, they are saving to buy a larger and better constructed house in an area closer to the city where they hope to start a small grocery store. Right now, they are concentrating on planting large amounts, and using their new land for a different variety of potato which is more resistant to the advancing summer season when there isn´t any rain and the fields will be dry. This is the fourth loan he has had with MFP and it has turned out that since its composed of responsible people who pay on time, he likes working with his village bank. WIth the money he´s requesting, he would like to buy a bag of pea seed and 35 sacks of potato seed.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Jencen

texts.es:
Jencen tiene 22 años, quien vive junto a su pareja, Diana de 20 años, y su hijo Kenyi de 2 años, en la casa de sus suegros.

A un kilómetro de la ciudad se ubican los terrenos agrícolas que les cedieron sus padres y suegros para que puedan sembrar papa. Paralelamente, con la ayuda de su esposa, cría 2 vacas, de las que extrae leche y elaboran quesos para venderlos; también tienen 2 toros, 3 ovejas y 5 cerdos, los que comercializa cuando se le presenta algún problema económico.
Jencen se dedica a las labores agrícolas desde hace 4 años y con las ganancias obtenidas está implementando los artefactos electrodomésticos, muebles y otras necesidades para de su familia para tener una adecuada calidad de vida. 
Ahora se proyecta a comprar más terrenos de cultivo y en su vivienda instalará una tienda de comestibles para que lo administre su esposa, mientras él venderá animales en las ferias semanales que se desarrollan en su ciudad.                       

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como siempre, está seguro que pagará cada cuota puntualmente, porque los miembros de su banco comunal son bastante cumplidos y responsables.  Con los quinientos soles que solicita tiene pensado comprar algunos sacos de semilla de papa, abono y fertilizante.
texts.en:
Jencen is 22 years old, and lives with his partner Diana (20) and their son Kenyi (2) in his parents-in-law's house. A kilometer from the city, he owns two pieces of land that his parents and parents-in-law gave him so that he could plant potatoes. Currently, with the help of his partner he raises two cows which he milks to make cheese to then sell. They also have two bulls, three sheep, and five pigs all of which he may sell if financial trouble demands it. Jencen has worked in agriculture for four years and with the income he is generating, he is slowly replacing household appliances and furniture, and fulfilling other family needs. Thus, he improves his family's lifestyle. He would like to now buy more land for planting. He will also build a food store at home that his wife will manage. In the meantime, he will sell animals in the weekly markets around his town. This is the fifth loan Jencen has requested from Kiva partner MFP. As always, he is sure he will pay every installment on time because his communal bank's members are quite dedicated and responsible. With the PEN 500 he is requesting, he hopes to buy bags of potato seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un joven entusiasta y muy trabajador de 30 años, vive con su pareja, Flor de 27 años, y sus 2 hijos: Leonel de 4 y Nahomi de 1 año. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en el pueblo de Huaylahuichan en la ciudad de Tarma.

Desde hace 15 años, junto a su esposa, se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz y arveja, con sus ganancias lograron compraron terrenos donde sembraron gran cantidad de maíz como vemos en la foto. Además están ahorrando para que no les falte nada a sus hijos en el futuro ni ahora. Mientras su esposa se encarga de contratar operarios para que limpien y cuiden sus sembríos, él y su hermano, viajan a vender choclo en un mercado de la ciudad de Lima. 
Dentro de sus actividades agrícolas lo que a veces lo desalienta es que los productos, por temporadas, pierden su valor y cuestan menos, sin embargo asegura que no pierde, pues siempre le quedan ganancias.
Para su futuro anhela tener su propio vehículo para trasladar sus productos a la capital y dejar de pagar el transporte; también quiere trabajar independientemente de su hermano para obtener mayores utilidades.

Este es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y considera que desde que accedió a los créditos y es parte de un banco comunal está progresando mucho, por lo que ya no quiere parar su ritmo de labor diaria. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta de choclos.
texts.en:
Juan is an enthusiastic and hardworking young man; he is 30 years old and lives with his partner, Flor (27) and their two children: Leonel (4) and Nahomi (1). His house is located in the town of Huaylahuichan, in the city of Tarma. For the last 15 years, along with his wife, Leonel has been planting potatoes, corn, and peas. With their earnings, Leonel and Flor have been able to buy two pieces of land where they have planted lots of corn (as we see in the picture). In addition, they are saving so that their kids will want for nothing, neither now, nor in the future. While his wife is in charge of hiring farm hands who clean and take care of their crops, Leonel and his brother travel to sell the corn at a market in Lima. In his activities, Leonel is disappointed that sometimes, products lose some of their value according to the season; however, he assures us he doesn't lose anything, as he always makes a profit. In the future, Leonel would like to have his own vehicle to transport his products to the capital city and in that way, stop paying for transportation. He'd also like to work independently of his brother in order to increase his earnings. This is the 8th loan Leonel is receiving from Kiva partner MFP and he believes that since requesting credit and becoming a part of a communal bank, he has gotten ahead quite a bit and does not want to stop his daily work rhythm. He will use the loan proceeds to invest in his corn business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in his corn business

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es:
Yudith es una mujer trabajadora de 21 años y está casada con Víctor de 24 años. Viven junto a sus 2 hijos: Ángelo de 5 y Ángela de 8 meses de nacida; su casa es propia y está ubicada en una zona alta y fría de la sierra del Perú.

Desde hace 12 años, se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y algunas verduras en sus terrenos propios, esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo, quien la motiva cuando el trabajo se hace pesado. A diario los dos asisten a sus chacras para asegurase del correcto crecimiento de sus cultivos, pues una buena cosecha les brinda las ganancias necesarias para darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. A Yudith le gustan mucho las labores agrícolas, pues nació y creció en el campo; además considera que es rentable, puesto que le permite comprar otros terrenos, cubrir las primeras necesidades de su familia, y lo más importante, ahorrar para que más adelante puedan comprar un carro con el cual trasladar sus productos al mercado de la ciudad.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas muy alegres, optimistas y sobre todo responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará varios sacos de abono, además de semilla de arveja y papa.
texts.en:
Yudith is a hardworking 21-year-old and she's married to Víctor who is 24. They live with their children - Ángelo (5) and Ángela (8 months) - in their own home located on a high and cold region of the sierras of Peru. For the last 12 years, Yudith has planted potatoes, peas and some vegetables in her own land with the help of her husband, who motivates her when the work becomes heavy. Daily, the two of them tend their fields to ensure the growth of their crops, since a good harvest will yield the profit necessary to provide a good life for their children. Yudith likes farm work because she was born and raised in the country side; besides, farming gives her a good income that allows her to buy other land, tend to the needs of her family, and most importantly, save so that they can buy a car with which to take their products to the city market in the future. This is the fifth loan Yudith requests from Kiva partner MFP; she likes working at her communal bank because its members are happy, optimistic, and above all, responsible. With the loan proceeds, she will buy several bags of fertilizer, and potato and pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor se caracteriza por ser una persona de buenos sentimientos, tiene 38 años y está casada con Wilmer de 40 años. Esta pareja tiene dos hijos: David de 20 y Javier de 17 años, todos viven en su casa propia.

Desde hace 20 años, además de ser una excelente agricultora es una muy buena comerciante. Por las mañanas vende productos agrícolas oriundos de la sierra en un puesto del mercado de la ciudad y luego de las 10 de la mañana asiste a su esposo en sus chachas, pues ambos laboran juntos, tanto en el campo como en el hogar. Los productos que cultivan son el maíz, la papa, arveja y diferentes verduras muy demandadas en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta  a Leonor es recomendar a sus clientes qué puede cocinar con sus productos, por otro lado lo que le incomoda es encontrarse con algunas personas aprovechadas en el mercado.
Ella se muestra muy contenta con lo que hace, por lo que en el futuro desea ampliar su puesto con mayor cantidad de mercadería, pues sus ventas se han incrementaron debido a la buena atención que brinda.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra satisfecha con el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal, ya que refiere que aprende de las experiencias de sus compañeros. En busca de una cosecha exitosa, con el dinero que ahora solicita, pretende comprar varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes; a su vez también invertirá en su puesto del mercado.
texts.en:
Leonor is a nice person, is 38 years old, and is married to Wilmer (40). This couple has two sons: David (20) and Javier (17), and they all live in their own home. For the last 20 years, on top of being an excellent farmer, Leonor has been a very capable business woman. In the mornings she sells products from the sierra at the stall she has at a market in the city. After 10 a.m., she helps her husband with his house chores, since they work together both in the fields and in the home. They plant corn, potatoes, peas, and several vegetables that are in high demand in the market. What Leonor likes best is suggesting to her clients what to cook with the produce they buy. On the other hand, she doesn't like people at the market who take advantage of others. Leonor seems happy with what she does, but in the future would like to expand her business by offering more products, especially since her sales have gone up thanks to the great customer service she provides. This is the fifth loan Leonor requests from Kiva partner MFP. She is happy with her communal bank, where she tells us she learns from her fellow members' experiences. In hopes of a successful harvest, she will use the loan proceeds to buy several bags of fertilizer, and to invest in her little stall at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una carismática y encantadora mujer D. 54 años, está casada con José D. 55 años y tiene dos hijos, pero sólo viven con Cici D. 13 años. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en una zona céntrica D. la selva central del Perú.

DesD. hace 7 años labora ofreciendo productos para el hogar, asimismo trabaja en el transporte público trasladando personas en su moto carro, pero lo que más le gusta es el comercio. 
Para ella, su negocio es bastante rentable y tranquilo porque compra al por mayor y los comercializa por unidades, y gracias a estas ganancias compró una moto lineal, artefactos para su vivienda y logra cubrir los gastos domiciliarios. Con el tiempo desea instalar y administrar su propio negocio D. venta D. enseres para el hogar, pues asegura que en este negocio tiene mucha experiencia.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está feliz D. continuar con los integrantes D. su banco comunal, a quienes considera gente muy unida y sobre todo responsable. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará decenas D. tollas, cubre camas, cortinas, adornos florales, entre otros artículos, para su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a charismatic and charming woman. She is 54 years old, is married to José (55) and has two children, though only one, Cici (13) lives with them. She owns her own home, which is located in a central region in the central forests of Peru. For the last seven years, María has been selling household products and driving people around in her moto-taxi; what she likes best, however, is her commercial activity. Her business makes good profit - she buys wholesale and sells retail. Thanks to her earnings, she has bought a motorcycle and household appliances for herself, and she is able to sustain her family. In time, she would like to start and manage her own store selling household items, an area in which she already has a lot of experience. This is the fourth loan she requests from Kiva partner MFP. She is happy to remain a part of her communal bank since she likes her fellow members, whom she considers close friends and above all, responsible borrowers. With the the money she is requesting, she will buy towels, bedspreads, curtains, floral centerpieces, among other items, to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her stock of products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy trabajadora y honesta de 49 años, tienen 3 hijos pero sólo vive con dos de ellos: Luis de 23 e Irsa de 18 años, en una casa alquilada.

Ella está orgullosa de trabajar como ayudante de cocina en un reconocido hotel de tres estrellas de nombre “Reyna” ubicado en la ciudad de La Merced. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 meses y le gusta mucho, pues se siente tranquila y útil; a su vez trabaja con su hermana en la elaboración y venta de empanadas, por lo que también percibe ingresos económicos.
Las ganancias que obtiene por ambas actividades le permiten vivir cómodamente y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, quienes también colaboran con algunos gastos de la vivienda donde viven. En adelante desea emprender en el negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, aprovechando las sus buenas relaciones que tiene con sus vecinos y amigos.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra contenta de trabajar en su banco comunal porque está integrando por personas unidas y responsables. Con los mil soles que solicita comprará gran cantidad de ropa y zapatos, los cuales distribuirá entre las personas que ya le hicieron pedidos.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking and honest woman. She is 49 years old and has three children; two of them live with her Luis (23) and Irsa (18) in a rented house. María is proud to work as a kitchen assistant at a well known 3-star hotel named Reyna, located in the city of La Merced. She has been working at the hotel for six months, and she likes it a lot because she feels calm and useful. Additionally, she works with her sister making and selling "empanadas" (turnovers), activity that also earns her money. What she earns with both work activities allows her to live comfortably and to tend to the needs of her children, who also contribute toward some of the household's expenditures. In the future, María would like to start selling clothes and shoes, taking advantage of the good relations she has with friends and neighbors. This is the second loan she requests from Kiva partner MFP. She seems happy to be working at her comunal bank because the bank's members are close to each other and responsible borrowers. With the PEN 2,000 she is requesting, she will buy lots of clothes and shoes to sell to the people who have already put in orders.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Starting a new business

loans.name: Senaida

texts.es:
Senaida, de 35 años, está casada con Salomón de 36 años; tienen 3 hijos: Miguel de 15, José de 13 y Sarvia de 10 años, todos viven juntos en su casa propia.

Desde hace 3 años trabaja en la elaboración de cajones para el embalaje de frutas, por lo que semanalmente le pagan 90 soles. Paralelamente tiene cultivos de plátano y café que cuida con la ayuda de sus hijos, mientras que su esposo labora como conductor de un carro de transporte de pasajeros. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es vender los cajones que fabrica con sus propias manos y ver qué tan resistente son, para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas. 
Senaida considera que su trabajo es rentable porque con las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar terrenos de cultivo donde sembró café, el cual cosechará en el mes próximo; asimismo logra cubrir los gastos domiciliarios y la educación de sus hijos. 
Para el futuro desea instalar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda para que sus hijos puedan administrarla y obtener sus propios ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está satisfecha de trabajar en su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son unidos y solidarios. Con los mil soles que ahora solicita adquirirá decenas plantas de café y cien javas vacías para encajonar plátanos.
texts.en:
Senaida (35) is married to Salomón (36); they have three children - Miguel (15), José (13) and Sarvia (10) - and they all live together in their own home. For the last three years, Senaida has been working making boxes for storing fruit, for which she earns PEN 90 per week. Senaida also plants plantains and coffee with the help of her children, while her husband works as a bus driver. Senaida's favorite activity is selling the boxes she makes with her own hands and seeing how strong the boxes are, and how useful for people. Senaida believes her work is profitable because she has been able to use her earnings to buy fields in which she has planted coffee and which she will harvest next month. She is also able to cover the household expenses and her children's education. In the future, Senaida would like to have a grocery store at home that her children could manage and thus earn their own incomes. This is the second loan Senaida requests from Kiva partner MFP. She is happy to work at her communal bank because its members show unity and solidarity with each other. With the loan of PEN 1,000, she will buy coffee plants and 100 empty boxes to store plantains.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying coffee plants

loans.name: Shah Raza

texts.en:
This young man is Shah Raza the son of M.. He lives in 13th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 25, single, and a hard working boy. He is a taxi driver.

Shah Raza became engaged two years ago and now he wants to get married. He needs money for some of his wedding expenses, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani.

Shah Raza would like to mention that Kiva is the best process which can support the entrepreneurs and those who are really in need of money.

loans.use: To pay wedding expenses

loans.name: Freba Group

texts.en:
This is Freba group which is made up of four female members. Jamila is the group leader.

Jamila is married with five children and lives in 1st district of Kabul, Afghanistan. She wants to take a loan for her husband who has a cart selling fresh fruit. Jamila cleans the fruit at home and then her husband sells it in the market. She wishes to receive the loan in order to expand their shared business.

The second member, Sohila, wants to take a loan for her brother who sells secondhand shoes in a small shop. He would like to purchase more shoes with the money to attract lots of clients.

The third member, D. Jan, wishes to borrow money for her husband who sells secondhand clothes. By receiving the loan he would like to expand his business to support his family members in a better way.

The last member, Freba, also wants to take the loan for her husband’s retail shop. He needs to complete his inventory.

Together, they have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fruit for her husband's business

loans.name: Naghma Sarayan Qalacha Group

texts.en:
This is'Naghma Sarayan Qalacha' group. Khalida is the group leader and a good tailor. She lives in Kabul Afghanistan. She is married with 5 children.They are all studens of shool and University. She is an experienced tailor and can sew all kinds of clothes. She has lots of clients and she is happy that she can support her childern through the income of her tailoring. With the loan she wants to purchase a new sewing machine. She hopes to have a shop for her tailoring and hire one empolyee there as well.
She is thankful to Kiva lenders becasue they support people thought their effecitv process.

loans.use: purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sali

texts.en:
Sali is a school teacher who enjoys a very good reputation for her commitment and being loved by her students and colleagues. Sali has been divorced recently and moved to live with her parents; she now helps them in taking care of household expenses. Therefore she asked for a personal loan from FATEN to pay off some of her family's debts.

Sali is an ambitious school teacher, works as hard as possible with her students and looks forward to being in a better position in her school in the future.

Sali and her father are the ones who are standing in front of FATEN's office in the picture above.

loans.use: Pay off family debts

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina was married when she was 20 years old. She is the mother of three sons and three daughters: two of her daughters are married and the third one is working in a sewing workshop in Jineen; one of the sons is an employee of the Palestinian Authority while the other two are college students.

Fatina's husband is a farmer besides owning a small general store. Fatina runs the store when her husband is working on the farm.

Fatina's loan from FATEN is going to be used to help her husband improve his small general store as well as participating in paying off her sons' college tuition fees.

loans.use: To improve her husband's store and to pay her sons' tuition fees

loans.name: Rawda

texts.en:
To be able to afford to buy a car and to purchase material for the embroidery business she is planning to start, Rawda applied for a loan from FATEN. As she comes from a conservative background, her husband Muhammad appears in the photo instead.

Rawda lives in Al-Jdaydeh, a village in Jineen district which is located on a 300-meter high mountain. Therefore her husband thought of purchasing a car. Rawda says that having a car will help the family travel easier and be able to distribute the embroideries she will start producing.

This embroidery project, Rawda believes, will help her husband afford the family's expenses as they have two daughters and two sons.

loans.use: To purchase a car and buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Mrs. Laurencia G. is 52 years old, married, and a resident of Minsubong, Tangub City. She is blessed with five adult-aged children. Her husband, Dionesio, is currently engaged in a bamboo furniture-making business and earns an average income of 5,000 PHP per month. Laurencia assists her husband in the preparation of the bamboo poles used for making the furniture. She also helps her husband market the finished bamboo furniture products. She joined PMPC two years ago. With a good repayment record, she was given a principal amount of 10,000 PHP for her fourth-cycle loan to increase the capital for their bamboo furniture-making business. The couple has a strong determination that someday their business will become known in other cities and in neighboring municipalities.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional capital for her bamboo furniture-making business

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
