Paz M. is from the village of Mahinog in the Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Paz is separated from her spouse and has seven adult-aged children. To earn a living, Paz owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear items like ladies clothes, bags, and curtains in the local community. Paz has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Paz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: M.lagrosa's Group

texts.en:
Magdalina L. L. is from the village of Canubay. She is 45 years old. Magdalina L. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is M.L.'s Group.

Magdalina L. is married and has three adult-aged children. To earn a living, Magdalina L. owns and operates a snack vending business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Magdalina L. has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Magdalina L. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalina L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Magdalina L. is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Magdalina L. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda P. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. She is 4 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Brenda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Brenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Mrs. Esterlita B. is 59 years of age and a resident of Dumalogdog in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is already widowed. She is blessed with one child who is now an adult.

She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. This is her 7th loan she is borrowing 8,000 PHP. She will use her loan to buy additional products to sell.

She is struggling to look forward to a bright future for her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario B. is from the city of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. He is 33 years old. Mario is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mario buys and sells bananas in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Mario's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita V. lives in Barangay 18A, Purok 3, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Crestita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Crestita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Crestita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Crestita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crestita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Crestita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Crestita's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Morris Albert

texts.en:
Morris Albert C. is from the city of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. He is 27 years old. Morris Albert is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Morris Albert owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where he sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Morris Albert has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Morris Albert joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Morris Albert is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Morris Albert's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Gertudes

texts.en:
Grertudes B. is from the village of East Poblacion in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old and married, and has 2 adult children. 

To make a living, Gertudes provides rooms for rent in the local community. Gertudes has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gertudes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gertudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Gertudes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to create more rooms for rent. This will be Gertudes's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. texts.en: Mrs. C. weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes many sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband (he is pictured) helps her sell and weave baskets. Recently, C. has run out of essential materials from her stock supply and she hopes to acquire other raw materials to continue making baskets. She depends on using her Kiva loan as an advance. The family lives with two kids who are enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla N. is from the village of Sta. Claro Road, Barangay 20, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Priscilla is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Priscilla owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Priscilla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Priscilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Priscilla is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Priscilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Nhao

texts.en:
Mr. Nhao Y. is a villager who lives in Chen village, Takeo province. He is 51 years old and married with six children. One of the children is a seamstress in the garment factory, three are car wash laborers and two are students in the local school.
Mr. Nhao Y. and his wife, Mrs. Choeun Kil, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to grow rice. In this dry farming season, they now face a problem because they do not have enough financial resources to support their farm. Thus, Mr. Nhao Y. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase fertilizer, rice seed, and fuel and to rent a plowing machine. His wife is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice seed, and fuel and rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en: This group has five people who live in Thkov village in Takeo province. Mrs. Hing S. is the group leader who was selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to grow rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Nem Sok, owns a wedding hall. They have some problems because the wedding hall supplies are too old to rent. Thus, in order to increase their income, Mrs. Hing S. decided to ask for a loan to buy some wedding hall supplies to rent. She is the mother of four children. Three of the children are enrolled in the local public school and the other one helps the parents.

loans.use: To buy wedding hall supplies to rent

loans.name: 010 Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Trang T. T. (76) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Trang is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 010 Quang Hung (010 Quang Hung).


Trang is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Trang owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  Trang has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,442,600 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Trang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND that will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Trang from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Trang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Ha (78) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  N. T. Thoi (95) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  N. T. Hue (83) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Javhlanbayar

texts.en: Javhalanbayar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Umnugobi province, Mongolia. His wife is a housewife and takes care of the two daughters, ages 8 and 3. His oldest daughter is in secondary school and the youngest is in kindergarten. He and his family lives in a “ger”, a traditional Mongolian tent.  After working as a fireman for several years, Javhalanbayar decided to start his own business. In 2009, he purchased tire repair equipment with a loan from Xacbank and started his tire repair business. The profits from his tire repair business have allowed him to build a working place in his yard. After years of successful business operations, Javhalanbayar has earned a good reputation among his customers for his excellent repair work. He hopes to have a sustainable workspace and large auto repair shop in the future. Also he wants to start a grocery shop in his yard so that his wife can earn money to supplement to their earnings. He says, “I am working hard in order to build a grocery shop for the future.” He is requesting a loan of 4,100,000 tugrugs to buy a truck for his business.

loans.use: To buy a truck

loans.name: Delvina

texts.en:
Delvina E. is from the village of Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Delvina owns & operates a general store. Delvina has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Delvina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delvina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Delvina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Delvina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Genalyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Genalyn owns & operates a business selling both food & daily use products like personal products such as shampoo and more in the local community. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Genalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en: Ourng R. is a villager who lives with other family members in Kampong Chhnang province. She cultivates a rice crop to make a living. She is a widow blessed with four children. Two are married, and the others are single. A daughter works as a dealer in a casino club. Ourng R. is taking out her loan to buy housing materials that she will use to construct a new house.

loans.use: To buy housing materials.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en: This group has four people who live in Pongro village in Takeo province. Mrs. Keo K. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. The group members will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family's living. Her husband, Mr. Sok Horn, is a duck breeder. This family has a problem in the rice field, because their farming is with infertile soil and they do not have money to improve it. Thus, Mrs. Keo K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of a child who is too small to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lecilda

texts.en:
Lecilda A. is from the village of Purok 5, Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Lecilda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lecilda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall (painitan). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and offering coffee in the local community. Lecilda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lecilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lecilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lecilda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lecilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon S. is 57 years old and lives in Chen village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. In this dry farming season, she does not have financial resources to support her farming. Thus, Mrs. Phon S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers to support her farming. Mrs. Phon S. is a widow with a child, who is a seamstress in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
S. is 56 years old and is a resident of Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. S. sells a few grocery items in front of her home where she is able to earn about $3 per day.

S. was married but her husband died of senility years ago. She has five children: three are married and two are single and are in the garment industry.

S. is looking for a loan in order to purchase more stock for her store. She intends to use some of the loan to buy different kinds of fruit to sell for extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Nicey's Group

texts.en:
Nicey A. is from the village of Mitimos, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 26 years old. Nicey is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nicey A. Group. Nicey is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Nicey A. owns & operates a business venture in  selling daily products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from  selling daily products in the local community. Nicey has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Nicey joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nicey is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nicey from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store, for motor repair, and furniture making

loans.name: Urangerel

texts.en:
Urangerel is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Umnugobi province, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is in university and the youngest attends a local secondary school. They live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a  “ger”. Urangerel manages a souvenir trading business out of a rented stall in her town. She began her business operation in 2002 after working as a teacher in a kindergarten for several years.  She sells a wide variety of souvenir goods made from felt and wool.  

She received a loan from XacBank in order to start her business and over the years her business improved and expanded. She usually makes all the souvenir products by herself. With her business earnings she bought a car for her husband so that he could earn money. She has developed a loyal base of customers and works hard to adapt her business to their needs.  She is focused on the future and says, "I am selling my products much cheaper compared with other business owners of same business.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more souvenir products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenir products

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
In this story, our featured entrepreneur is an operator of fish traps locally known as “bunsod”. She is Mrs. Mercy A., 41 years of age, married and a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. The couple was blessed with 6 children and most are now adults or teenagers. Only one is a minor dependent. Her husband is a fisherman and he maintains the “bunsod”. For 25 years, they’re been in this kind of business and have been able to sustained the family even in times of bad weathers and economic downfalls.  At the present time they were earning an average net income of not less than P15,000.00.  With excellent character and a good credit record, she was approved for the loan amount of P20,000.00. 

This is her 7th cycle loan and will provide capital to purchase fishing nets for additional bunsod unit and for general repair and maintenance. The future profit of this loan will be used for their daily basic needs, loan repayments and savings for her children’s future, especially for their education. She hopes that someday all her children will become successful. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets and "bunsod" repair

loans.name: Roeun Chab Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun C. is a 61 year old married woman who lives in Ta Su village, Takeo province. She is a member of a village bank loan group consisting of 5-people. With this loan they hope to increase their income to improve their family living conditions. Mrs. Roeun C. and her husband, Mr. Ten Chan, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow crops to earn for living.

Mrs. Roeun C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy timber and zinc strips to improve the structure of her house. This couple has one child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy timber and zinc strips for house repair

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 34 años, vive junto a su esposo Basilio de 36 años y sus 5 hijos: Alber de 16, Karen de 13, Hellín de 10, Evelin de 6 y Jack de 3 años. Esta numerosa familia vive en su casa propia en la selva central peruana.

Desde hace 7 años cultiva plátanos, café y maíz con la ayuda de operarios, ya que son pocas las veces que su esposo la puede ayudar, pues él ocupa un cargo dentro de su comunidad que le quita mucho tiempo, principalmente en las mañanas, ya que tiene que debe gestionar obras como carreteras, puentes, agua y desagüe para su zona. Adela orgullosa menciona: “mi pareja es bastante conocido y siempre obtiene algo bueno para mi localidad, además es muy responsable como padre y esposo porque nunca nos hace faltar nada”. 
Por otro lado, con los ahorros que tenía compró más terrenos de cultivo para sembrar más productos (frutas) nativos de la selva.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, pues así viene progresando, contando también con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará plantas de café y plátanos, además adquirirá abono para asegurar sus chacras de fréjol, mango, piña y el resto de productos que cultiva.
texts.en:
Adela is a 34-year-old woman. She lives with her husband Basilio (36 years old) and their 5 children: Alber (16), Karen (13), Hellín (10), Evelin (6) and Jack (3). This large family lives in their own house in Peru's central jungle. For 7 years Adela has grown bananas, coffee and corn with hired help, since her husband cannot often help her. He holds a community position which takes a lot of his time, especially in the mornings, as he has to manage public works like highways, bridges, water and drainage for their area. Adela says proudly, "My husband is well-known and always gets something that is good for my town. He is also a very responsible father and husband because he never makes us do without anything that we need." She used her savings to buy more farmland so she could grow more food (fruits) that are native to the jungle. This is the fourth loan she has had with MFP, and she is very grateful to the people who make it possible for her to get a loan. She can have a better life because of them and also because of the support of her communal bank. With the money she is asking for now, she will buy coffee plants and banana plants. She will also get fertilizer for her beans, mangoes, pineapple and the other products she grows.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee and banana plants

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una humilde y cariñosa mujer de 46 años, está casada con Andrés de 55 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos: Alejandro de 15, Paulo de 14, Ever de 11, Ana de 10 y Lucio de 8 años.  

Pese a no saber leer ni escribir, ella no permite que exista discriminación en su pueblo, actitud que la hace muy respetada y querida desde el más pequeño hasta la persona mayor. 
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra café, plátanos y maíz, esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo, quien muchas veces se queda a dormir en la choza que tienen en sus chacras para cuidar sus cultivos, siendo Bertha la encargada de la administración de las ganancias, pero también trabaja en las chacras cuando es necesario. Segura de que su actividad económica es muy rentable, para el futuro desea adquirir mayor cantidad de plátanos y yuca, que son productos de la selva muy requeridos en los mercados de las ciudades aledañas.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y gracias a la confianza que depositan en ella está progresando junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son muy organizados. Para obtener mayores ingresos, con el dinero que ahora solicita, pretende comprar 230 plantas de plátanos y varios sacos de abono para nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
46-year-old Bertha is a rather loving, humble woman. She is married to Andres, age 55, and they have five children together: Alejandro (15), Paulo (14), Ever (11), Ana (10) and Lucio, who is 8. Although she can't read or write, she has no patience for discrimination. She has a great attitude that has earned her plenty of respect from everyone she knows, both young and old. Bertha and her husband have been farming coffee, bananas and maize for about 10 years. In order to better tend the crops, her husband often sleeps in a hut out on the fields. Bertha looks after the business end of things, but also helps with the crops whenever it's necessary. She's confident that her business has a good outlook, so she wants to farm more banana and yuca, which are both in high demand at nearby markets. This is Bertha's fourth loan with MFP. She's very thankful for the confidence the organization has in her and the other members of her community bank, all of whom are quite well organized. In order to increase her profits, she plans to buy 230 banana trees and several sacks of fertilizer, which will increase yields.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying banana trees and fertilizer

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom K. is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Lorn Seam are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating rice.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Mom K. is also a clothes seller who owns a store where she can earn a small income to help support her family. In order to support her business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more clothes to enlarge the business, and also a cart to transport the clothes she sells.  She hopes that the loan will increase her income and improve her family's standard of living, too. 

Mrs. Mom K. is the mother of two children, who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny B. is a 50 year old married woman who lives in Ping Pong village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhart Hem, are farmers who own 1.50 hectare field to cultivate rice. Right now is dry season, they want to cultivate rice but they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Ny B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and fuel to support her farming.
Mr. Nhart Hem is also a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family living. This couple has five children, one is a construction worker, three are students in the local school, and the last one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and fuel

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana tiene 50 años, vive con su amado esposo Rosalindo de 55 años, tienen 4 hijos: Franklin de 16, Linger de 15, Madelin de 13 y Gisela de 9 años.

Cada mañana se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas con sus herramientas de trabajo en mano porque le gusta ver sus chacras siempre limpias. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo desde hace 10 años. Los productos que siembran son el maíz, plátanos, yuca y café. Gracias a la buena administración de las ganancias, su familia no pasa necesidades económicas, sino por lo contrario vive cómodamente.
Para el futuro, desea plantar la mayor cantidad de plátano y maíz, por lo que está comprando más terrenos, con la esperanza de convertirse en una comerciante mayorista de frutos de la selva.

Es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP, ella está muy contenta porque su banco comunal se hace fuerte cada día, pues está conformado por personas trabajadoras y responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 150 plantas de plátano y varios sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Eliana is 50 yeras old and lives with her beloved husband Rosalindo, 55. They have 4 children: Franklin, 16, Linger, 15, Madelin, 13 and Gisela, 9. Every morning Eliana works on her agricultural plots with her work tools in hand because she loves to always see her farm clean. She has been doing this activity together with her husband for 10 years. The products that she sews are maize, plantains, yuca and coffee. Thanks to the good administration of her earnings, her family doesn't lack for necessities, in fact they live comfortably. In the future Eliana wishes to plant greater quantities of plaintains and maize, for which reason she is buying more land with the hope of becoming a major wholesaler of jungle fruits. This is the fourth loan she has had with MFP. Eliana is very content because her communal bank makes her strong every day, because it is made up of hard-working and responsible people. WIth the money she is seeking she will buy 150 plantain plants and various sacks of fertiliser.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plantain plants and fertiliser

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou S., age 27, is married and resides with her husband in Kompung Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has two school-aged children. 

She is engaged in a business of manufacturing traditional baskets to sell at home, earning an income of approximately $3 per day. By doing so, she is able to help cover her family expenses, most importantly for the children’s education. She has been in this business since 1992. 

Her husband travels everywhere in the province to sell the basket products, earning a gross income of $10 per day. The family's standard of living has been improved since S. started this business, and she wants a loan to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more baskets for resale. This is her third loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. (S. and her husband are pictured here)

loans.use: to buy more baskets for resale

loans.name: Elvin

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia con la compañera de su vida, Marcela de 34 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos: Lidia, Michael, Mariela, Gilberto y Dalicio.

Desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposa y sus hijos cultiva achote, frutas cítricas, café, plátanos, palta y piña en sus terrenos propios. Esta actividad es muy rentable porque les permite hacer crecer sus bienes al tener varias casas y chacras. Él quiere ser un buen ejemplo para sus hijos y vecinos: “yo quiero que mis vecinos digan, toda esa cosecha, esa cantidad de terreno tiene Elvin, cómo si antes no tenía nada, mira cómo a crecido y sigue creciendo, nosotros también trabajemos para tener como él, así quiero que hablen” manifiesta.

Adicionalmente, tiene un vivero donde cultiva plantas de café, tanto para sus chacras como para la venta, por lo que obtiene ingresos extras.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y como siempre se compromete a ser puntual en cada pago, pues de alguna manera quiere agradecer a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de crecer económicamente, además le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal. Con los dos mil quinientos que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar 200 plantas de frutas cítricas (naranjas, mandarinas) y decenas de injerto de palta.
texts.en:
Elvin is 44, and he lives in his own house with his 34 year old life partner, Marcela. They have 5 children: Lidia, Michael, Mariela, Gilberto and Dalicio. For 10 years, together with his wife and children, he has been growing “achote” (annato, a spice), citrus fruits, coffee, bananas, avocados, and pineapples on their own land. This activity is very profitable because it allows him to make his assets grow to have various houses and farms. He wants to be a good example for his children and neighbors. “I want my neighbors to say, ‘All of this harvest, all of the land the Elvin has, when before he had nothing. Look how he has grown and keeps growing. We also are working to have what he does.’ That is how I want them to talk,” he says. Additionally, he has a nursery where he grows coffee plants for his farms and for sale. This gives him extra income. This is his fourth loan with MFP. As always, he promises to be punctual with every payment. He wants to somehow thank the people who give him the opportunity to grow economically. He likes working in his communal bank. He will use the 2,000 PEN that he is now requesting to buy 200 citrus fruit plants (oranges and tangerines) and dozens of avocado grafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy citrus plants and avocados

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida es una alegre y atenta mujer de 35 años, que vive con su esposo Néstor de 35 años y sus 2 hijos: Kevin de 10 y Joel de 1 año. Ellos viven en la comodidad de su casa propia fabricada a base de madera. 

Desde hace 2 años se dedica al comercio de comestibles, mientras que su esposo cultiva plátano, maíz y café desde hace 10 años. “Mi esposo vive íntegramente dedicado a la chacra, pues al comercializar los frutos cubrimos nuestros gastos domésticos, mientras que el dinero que yo gano de la atención en la bodega lo ahorramos para comprar más terrenos”.

Actualmente, Frida y su esposo vienen invirtiendo en un vivero de plantas maderables (cedro, moena, copal, nogal entre otras especies).

Para el futuro, su anhelo es construir su casa de material noble (cemento y ladrillos), para que pueda ampliar su tienda, también desea sembrar más en busca de una mayor productividad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP, y su agradecimiento es para todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda salir adelante, lo que ha demostrado desde la primera reunión de su banco comunal y cada mes con sus pagos puntuales. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que esta vez solicita comprará mercadería (comestibles de primera necesidad, bebidas y útiles de escritorio) para surtir su bodega, con el resto del dinero comprará dos sacos de abono para esparcir sobre sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Frida is a cheerful and considerate 35 year old woman. She lives with her 35 year old husband, Néstor, and their two children. Kevin is 10 and Joel is 1. They live comfortably in their own house, which is made of wood. For two years she has been selling groceries. Her husband has been growing bananas, corn, and coffee for ten years. “My husband is completely devoted to the farm. Upon selling the fruit we cover our household expenses. We save the money that I earn in the convenience store to buy more land.” Frida and her husband are currently investing in a nursery for wood plants (cedar, moena, copal, walnut trees, and other species). In the future she wants to build her house from sturdy material (cement and bricks) so that she is able to expand her store. She also wants to plant more for greater productivity. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is grateful to all of the people who make it possible for her to get ahead. She has shown this since the first meeting with her communal bank, and she shows it every month with her punctual payments. She will use the 2,500 PEN that she is requesting this time to buy merchandise (basic needs foods, drinks, and office supplies) to stock her convenience store. With the rest of the money she will buy two sack of fertilizer to spread over the coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. V., 24, was married many years ago to Chanthy, age 31, and they currently earn their daily income by working in the garment factory. The couple always gets a specific salary of over two hundred dollars and they use it to send all their kids to school and to cover their family’s daily living expenses.

However, the current family income is not adequate to cover an expense so V. plans to make extra income by investing in a new trade. Because she lacks capital, she decided to request a loan to purchase pig feed and piglets to start raising.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and piglets to start raising

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva A. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 36 years old. Eva is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a business selling electronic products in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $160 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Eva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Eva is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana M. is from the village of Barangay 18A, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Mariana is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food stall (painitan), selling snacks and offering coffee in the local community. Mariana has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mariana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Mariana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Mrs. Yi H. is a 44-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a transport company, two are fishermen, and the other one is a student in the local school. This family lives in Ping Pong village, Takeo province.  
              
Mrs. Yi H. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field for cultivating rice. She now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farming. Thus, she is now requesting 1,000,000 KHR from the Kiva partner, AMK, to buy gasoline, pesticide and to hire a farm laborer to help with her farming.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, pesticide and hire farm labor

loans.name: Khoshi Group

texts.en:
This is the Khoshi group. It has four female members. Nazi, who is a good tailor, is the group leader. She has over five years of experience in tailoring. With the loan she would like to complete her stock of supplies for her business.

The second member, Fatima, would like to receive the loan for her business of making quilts. With the loan she would buy better quality materials to help advance the business.

Setara, another member of this group, wants to use the loan for her business of making curtains. She needs to buy an electric sewing machine to sew the curtains more easily.

The last member, Mena, wants to receive the loan for her husband who has a shop in which he sells construction materials. He would like to expand his business and bring about some changes in it.

They all have requested a group loan of 40,000 AFN and would like to thank all lenders of Kiva for their great support.

loans.use: to expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 62 años, es una mujer perseverante y muy correcta en sus acciones, hace muchos años se separó de su pareja, tiene un hijo que ya conformó su propio hogar, por ello vive sola en su casa propia.

A pesar de vivir sola siempre tuvo metas que alcanzar porque el motor de su vida es su hijo y porque ama las tierras que la vieron nacer y crecer: “aquí yo crecí comiendo choclo, papa sancochada y cancha, en otro lugar no me acostumbro, por eso no me voy a vivir con mi único hijo, porque me molesta el ruido de la ciudad y acá siempre tienes qué comer”, menciona.
Actualmente cultiva maíz, papa y arveja en los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres, trabaja sola y lo que más le gusta es sembrar alfalfa porque después de cortarla, retoña hasta cuatro veces y puede durar 3 años con buena producción; asimismo cría 150 cuyes, los que vende al por mayor para consumo (carne) y reproducción (cría). Como sus actividades son bastante rentables y pronto vendrá a vivir con ella su nieto de 15 años, piensa dedicarse al negocio de venta de alfalfa y de cuyes, pues quiere apoyarlo con los gastos de sus estudios.

Este es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y manifiesta: “yo no confío en otra entidad, porque nos ofrecen beneficios y al final no cumplen, además no se preocupan por ti como en esta institución, aquí estoy feliz trabajando en mi banco comunal”. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita comprará de 3 sacos de abono (potasio, nitrato y fosfato) para proteger sus cultivos de papa y los pastizales de alfalfa.
texts.en:
. Juana, 62, is a persevering woman who is very correct in everything she does. Many years ago she separated from her partner. She has an adult son, who has formed his own family so she lives alone in her own house. Despite always living alone, she had goals to meet because her son was the motivating force in her life and because she loves the land of her birth: "I grew up here eating corn, fried potato and toasted corn. I don't feel like myself in some other place, this is why I won't go live with my only son; the noise of the city annoys me and here, you always have something to eat" she says. Currently, she farms corn, potatoes and peas on land she inherited from her parents. She works alone and what she likes best is to plant alfalfa because, once it's cut, it resprouts up to four times and can last up to 3 years with good yields. She also raises 150 guinea pigs that she sells at wholesale both for consumption (meat) and for reproduction (raising). Because her activities are quite profitable and her 15-year-old grandson will soon come live with her, she plans to dedicate herself to alfafa growing and guinea pig raising because she wants to help him with his educational expenses. This is her 7th loan with MFP and she states: "I don't trust any other institution because they offer benefits and then don't come through. Besides, they don't care as much about you as this institution does; I'm happy here working in my communal bank." She will use the 2000 soles to buy three sacks of manure (potassium, nitrate and phosphate) to protect her potato crops and her alfalfa fields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Florepe

texts.en:
Florepe N. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 45 years old. Florepe is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Florepe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary C. is from the village of Ta Preah in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In order to support her farming, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to help her growing crops. 

Her husband, Mr. Chan Vorleak Nhim, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. 
                
Mrs. Sotheary C. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a student in the public school, while the second one is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Mrs. Rekha S. is a grocery store keeper in the Town of Sanepa. She opened her grocery store two years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks etc. She uses her income in fulfilling household needs.

Now she is requesting a 20,000 NPR loan to buy grocery goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mr. Thou U. is a villager who lives in Prey Chheu Teal village, Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Tei Pet, sells groceries where she can earn a littler income to support her family. Mr. Thou U. is a hardworking man with his farming. 

In order to improve his living situation and to support his wife's business, Mr. Thou U. would like to make a loan of 1,000,000 Riel from AMK. The loan will be used to bU. more groceries to enlarge his wife grocery shop to meet customer requirements and to improve their income. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Sonu

texts.en:
Sonu L. lives with her husband, Chakra Bahadur L., and their three children. Her husband is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu valley. Her two daughters are studying in grades 10 and 4 and her son is in primary school.

Sonu opened her small business three years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different food items in her shop. In particular, she makes Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice). She also sells tea and coffee.

The demand for food is increasing in her area, so Sonu is requesting her Rs 20,000 loan to buy necessary ingredients for her shop.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy laboriosa de 53 años, está casada con Benjamín de 50 años, tienen 6 hijos quienes en busca de un futuro mejor estudian en Lima (la capital del Perú), por eso ella vive sólo con su pareja en la casa que le heredó su madre. 

Desde hace 35 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, flores (gladiolos), variedad de verduras alfalfa y papa. Ambos se despiertan muy temprano y mientras ella prepara la comida del día, él se va a inspeccionar y regar sus tierras sembradas, o a cortar el pasto para alimentar a sus cuyes. A María le satisface haber sido perseverante, pues gracias a eso pudo cubrir la educación de sus hijos, quienes ahora cuentan con una carrera profesional, además todos los integrantes de la familia viven cómodamente. 
Para más adelante, desea comprar mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno, cuyes y otros animales menores, ya que sembrará hectáreas de alfalfa para su alimentación.

Esta es la décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está tranquila de trabajar en un banco comunal donde sabe que sus ahorros están muy bien cuidados. Con el dinero que ahora solicita piensa comprar varios sacos de abono, fertilizante, cinco botellas de insecticida y dos bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
María, 53, is a hard-working woman. She's married to Benjamín, 50. They have 6 children who, in search of a better future, are in school in Lima (the capital of Perú). Because of this, she lives alone with her husband in a house she inherited from her mother. For the last 35 years, she and her husband have farmed corn, gladioli, a variety of vegetables, alfalfa and potatoes. Both rise very early and, while she prepares the day's food, he goes out to inspect and water the planted fields or to cut grass to feed his guinea pigs. María feels satisfied to have persevered for, thanks to that, she was able to pay for the education of her childen, who now have professional careers. Besides, all the family members live comfortable lives. For later on, she wants to buy greater amounts of cattle, guinea pigs and other small farm animals since she will plant several hectares of alfalfa to feed them. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she is content to work in a communal bank where she knows her savings are well cared for. She will use the funds requested to buy several sacks of manure and fertilizer, five bottles of insecticide and two bags of pea seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Safarkhuja

texts.ru: Мусофиров Сафархуча проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Сафархуча занимается изготовлением и продажей муки. В этой деятельности он более 6 лет. Он продает муку, иготовленную из своей пшеницы. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Safarkhuja M. is 38 years old and lives in the city of Kulyab. He is married and has five children. His wife works at home. Safarkhuja is in business for himself preparing and selling flour. He has been involved in this activity for over six years. He sells flour, made from his own wheat. The loan is intended to increase his inventory.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio D. is from the village of Canubay, Oroquieta City. He is 27 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Antonio operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of different products such as Fern-C (a vitamin C supplement) in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Antonio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. Antonio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel P. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old and is single. Noel operates a business providing photography services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Noel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 65,000 PHP from GDMPC. Noel is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his 14th from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie P. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin. He is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Bernie owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Bernie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Reynan

texts.en: Reynan M. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. He is 28 years old and is single. Reynan owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Reynan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Reynan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha B. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Editha owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. Editha is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
Rosa C. is from the village of Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is thirty-two years old. Rosa is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Rosa's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
